Job Title:  Solutions Architect   $%^& Company Name:  FundSERV Inc.   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, Canada Area   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>The Solution Architect's role is to analyze proposed and identified business requirements for new and existing business systems, design and present efficient technical solutions.  This individual will gain business commitment for all business systems and software plans.  The incumbent will be responsible to evaluate and select technology solutions required to complete those plans. In addition, the incumbent will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.  The Solution Architect provides technical leadership across the organization, from strategic decision making down to the project planning level. <p></p></p><p><strong>Strategy and Planning</strong> </p><ul><li>Lead projects from a technical aspect by providing solution analysis, planning, design and development, of new applications and enhancements to existing applications. </li><li>Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business systems issues. </li><li>Conduct research on emerging technologies in support of solution development efforts, and recommend technologies that will increase cost effectiveness and systems flexibility. </li><li>Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems. </li><li>Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems. </li><li>Provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to other Solution Architects and Software Developers within the application development team. </li></ul><p><strong>Integration</strong><strong> </strong><strong>and</strong><strong> </strong><strong>Deployment</strong> </p><ul><li>Assure completeness of deployment plans of new applications and enhancements to existing applications. </li><li>Conduct research on software products and tools to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts when selected as part of proposed technical solutions. </li><li>Where applicable, design, lead, and oversee the implementation of end-to-end integrated systems. </li><li>Document the Company’s existing business systems architecture and technology portfolio; make recommendations for improvements and/or alternatives. </li></ul><p><strong>Solution</strong><strong> </strong><strong>Management</strong> </p><ul><li>Create IT Solution proposals. </li><li>Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed solutions to aid management in making implementation decisions. </li><li>Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers. </li><li>Model business and systems processes based on findings through use case scenarios, workflow diagrams, and data models. </li><li>Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews and systems technical performance reviews, for modified and new systems.  Report on findings and make recommendations for improvement. </li><li>Provide orientation and training to end users for all modified and new systems. </li><li>Develop, document, communicate, and enforce a policy for standardizing systems and software as necessary.</li></ul></div></div><div class="skills-section"><h3 class="sub-header">Desired Skills and Experience</h3><div class="rich-text"><p><strong>Formal</strong><strong> </strong><strong>Education</strong><strong> </strong><strong>&</strong><strong> </strong><strong>Certification</strong> </p><ul><li>College Diploma or University Degree in the field of computer science/engineering or information systems. </li><li>Minimum 5 years related work experience. </li></ul><p><strong>Knowledge</strong><strong> </strong><strong>&</strong><strong> </strong><strong>Experience</strong> </p><ul><li>Extensive experience in designing strategic solutions and architectural models for business systems. </li><li>Hands-on experience with functional and non-functional requirements gathering/analysis. </li><li>Comprehension of emerging technologies (e.g. Cloud, Mobile, et cetera) and there application in the business domain. </li><li>Understanding of real-time and complex environment processing. </li><li>Strong understanding of information processing principles and practices. </li><li>Solid grounding in core middleware enterprise solutions. </li><li>In-depth technical knowledge of Unix/Linux based operating systems. </li><li>Working technical knowledge of current systems software, network protocols, programming languages and standards. </li><li>Strong knowledge of software evaluation principles and practices. </li><li>Working knowledge of JEE application servers (WebSphere, Weblogic, et cetera). </li><li>Solid knowledge/experience in Java, OO design patterns, BPM, Messaging. </li><li>Solid knowledge/experience in data warehousing, data management, data lakes, and BI tools. </li><li>Understanding of common Enterprise Architecture frameworks. </li></ul><p><strong>Personal</strong><strong> </strong><strong>Attributes</strong> </p><ul><li>·Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities. </li><li>·Superior written and oral communication skills. </li><li>·Excellent listening and interpersonal skills. </li><li>·Ability to conduct research into emerging technologies and trends, standards, and products as required. </li><li>·Ability to present ideas in both technical and user-friendly language. </li><li>·Demonstrated project management skills. </li><li>·Highly self-motivated and directed. </li><li>·Keen attention to detail. </li><li>·Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. </li><li>·Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.</li></ul></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description"><p>FundSERV is a business-to-business electronic network with world-class transaction processing applications, servicing the Canadian investment industry. Established in 1993, FundSERV is an online hub that electronically connects fund companies, distributors and intermediaries, enabling them to buy, sell and transfer investment funds amongst each other.   The business services hundreds of organizations – representing approximately 150,000 daily network transactions – and provides online access to over 35,000 investment fund products. <p></p></p><p><strong>MISSION -</strong>To provide reliable and resilient value-added network and application services for B2B initiatives that minimize risk and promote timely, automated interactions that reduce cost and improve the ease of doing business within the Canadian investment industry. <p></p></p><p><strong>VISION -</strong> To be a respected leader in low-cost, low-risk, straight-through-processing for the investment industry.  </p><p>  </p><p><strong>CORPORATE OBJECTIVES</strong> </p><ul><li><strong>Operational Excellence</strong> – Continue to maintain and enhance FundSERV’s robust operational and technology platform. </li><li><strong>Engaged Workforce -</strong> Develop a high performance, empowered workforce where we are 100% accountable for our results. </li><li><strong>Client Intimacy</strong> – Be respected by the members of the industries in which we serve. </li><li><strong>Business Growth</strong> – Create value for our clients by increasing the usage of current products or developing new service offerings with significant uptake. </li></ul><p>  </p><p><strong>CORE CORPORATE VALUES</strong> </p><ul><li><strong>Entrepreneurship</strong> – We are responsible to create risk calculated opportunities which support our mission. </li><li><strong>Transparency</strong><em> </em>– We are open, honest and value two way feedback while fostering an environment of trust. </li><li><strong>Versatility </strong>– We are flexible and adapt to changing business needs. </li><li><strong>Collaboration</strong> – We work as a team with freedom to share ideas.</li></ul></div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  IT Analyst, PMI Analytics Systems   $%^& Company Name:  CPP Investment Board   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, Canada   $%^&   Job Description:  The IT Analyst is responsible for providing operational support for Information Technology applications, primarily for systems that enable portfolio management and analytics functions. This role is also responsible for contributing to the continuous improvement of the supportability and stability of our technology systems. This includes working with development teams to identify and resolve recurring operational issues, automating manual and error-prone processes, documenting support procedures and best practices, and involvement in disaster recovery planning and testing.<br><br>Candidates who join this team will have an opportunity to:<br><ul><li>Broaden and deepen business and technical knowledge across portfolio management and trading application boundaries</li><li>Develop a wider network of deep working relationships across IT and business clients</li><li>Further develop soft skills in communication, relationship management and leadership</li></ul><br><strong>Specific Responsibilities</strong><br><br>The IT Analyst is responsible for the following:<br><ul><li>Ensure application systems are operating within service levels</li><li>Troubleshoot problem areas (in person, by telephone, or via e-mail) within service levels on a level I and/or II basis.</li><li>Apply analytical and technical skills to proactively identify, track, manage, and resolve software and technical issues</li><li>Provide knowledge transfer of application support and deployment processes to team members and other support personnel</li><li>Identify and automate manual and error-prone processes</li><li>Maintain disaster recovery plan and participate in periodic offsite testing</li><li>Facilitate root cause analysis and follow through to ensure corrective actions are realized</li><li>Report to management on incident management events and trends</li><li>Validate and make recommendations to improve to ensure systems are supportable</li><li>Actively work with development team to represent opportunities to reduce operational risk and improve supportability and stability of our systems</li></ul><br> Position Requirements <br><ul><li>University Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar</li><li>3-5 years experience providing operational support to a production software system</li><li>Proficiency in both Windows and Linux environments would be strongly preferred</li><li>3-5 years experience with application performance monitoring and tuning preferred</li><li>Proactive, detail oriented and extremely well organized with strong analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Working experience with infrastructure monitoring tools such as Zabbix are an asset</li><li>Working experience with automated deployments with tools such as IBM UrbanCode and Liquibase would be an asset</li><li>Experience in a financial services environment and/or CSC certification would be an asset</li><li>Working knowledge of Python for scripting and automation would be an asset</li><li>Exemplify CPPIB Guiding Principles of integrity, partnership and high performance</li></ul><br>At CPP Investment Board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.<br><br>We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process<br><br><strong>Disclaimer:</strong><br><br>CPP Investment Board does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investment Board to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. Job Title:  Software Developer Intern, MS/PhD, Summer 2016   $%^& Company Name:  Google   $%^&   Job Location:  Kitchener, ON, Canada   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong>Applications are due by February 29, 2016 at 11:59pm PST. Our team will review applications on a rolling basis and it's in the candidates best interest to apply early. All hiring will be complete by April 2016. Thank you for your patience while we consider your application.</strong><br><br>Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.<br><br>As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.<br><br>Software Developers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our developers develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - which requires research, awareness, interactivity, and asking questions. You build strong competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a solid foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of developers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality. <br><br>As a Software Developer, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas: <br><br><strong>Product and Systems Development</strong><br><br>Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers). <br><br><strong>Engineering Productivity</strong><br><br>As a software developer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated testsystems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best and brightest developers working in this group. <br><br><strong>Site Reliability</strong><br><br> Software developers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud-based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software developers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google - fast, reliable and accessible to all. <br><br>Responsibilities<br><ul> <li>Perform specific responsibilities which vary by project area</li> </ul><br><br>Minimum qualifications<br><ul> <li>Currently pursuing a Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science or related technical field.</li><li>Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.</li> </ul><br><br>Preferred qualifications<br><ul> <li>Experience in systems software or algorithms.</li> <li>Familiarity with TCP/IP and network programming.</li> <li>Knowledge of Unix/Linux or Windows environments and APIs.</li> <li>Excellent implementation skills (C++, Java, Python).</li> </ul><br><br>Area<br><br>Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.<br><br>Kitchener-Waterloo <br><br>Kitchener-Waterloo is our biggest Canadian development office, home to Canooglers from around the world. We value speed and reward passion, prioritizing highly collaborative, cross-functional teams. computing. <br><br>We specialize in helping customers transition to service driven networks that fundamentally change the way they compete. You will also be requested to provide input and on occasion participate in global forums for process development and improvement activities. of work </li> <li> Ensure contractors work in accordance with health and safety guidelines </li> <li> Provide progress status updates to stakeholders/requestors </li> <li> Interact with GIC Capacity mgmt. planning teams and building operations </li> <li> Suggest continuous improvements to processes and templates </li> <li> Ensure stock levels of required installation materials </li> </ul> Purpose-built for the Industrial Internet, Bit Stew’s MIx Core™ platform automates data ingestion, applies machine intelligence to learn patterns in the data, allowing industrial companies to discover actionable insights that optimize operational performance. In 2015, Bit Stew was named to Greentech Media’s Grid Edge 20 list, as one of the top 20 innovators architecting the future of the electric power industry, and as one of the Top 100 Analytics Companies by Forbes Magazine. In 2014, Bit Stew was also recognized on the Gartner Cool Vendors in Energy & Utilities list and as the Frost & Sullivan Entrepreneurial Company of the Year – North American Service Solutions for Utilities. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  Data Warehouse Analyst   $%^& Company Name:  Ontario Securities Commission   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, Canada Area   $%^&   Job Description:  <p><strong>Data Warehouse Analyst<br> Full-time, Permanent<br> Corporate Services Branch, Information Technology<br> File #15-84<br> <br></strong>The<strong> Ontario Securities Commission (OSC)</strong> is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The Commission’s mandate is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices and to foster fair and efficient capital markets and confidence in capital markets.<br> <br>The <strong>Information Services Group</strong> is a part of the Corporate Services Branch and supports the full spectrum of OSC employees' information needs, ensuring that the organization can effectively regulate Ontario's capital market. Specifically, Information Services is responsible for system development and support, training, records and information management, and research and library services. Branch staff partner with managers and directors to develop solutions that both streamline operations and consolidate efforts to best effect across all points of information management and information technology.<br> <br>The <strong>Data Warehouse Analyst</strong> coordinates the technical data administration function for both data warehouse and data mart development and operational maintenance. The DWA is accountable for planning and oversight of the technical transitions between development, testing, and production phases of warehouse and databases design, and will facilitate change control, issue management, and communication among data warehouse architects, developers, analysts, and operations to achieve optimal outcomes. The Analyst will be accountable for establishing and enforcing organizational processes to ensure a consistent, well managed, and well integrated data warehouse infrastructure, and will use data manipulation, transformation, and cleansing tools to expand and improve data warehouses.<br> <br><strong>Qualifications:</strong> </p><ul><li>Undergraduate degree in an IT related discipline or equivalent </li><li>Minimum 6 years related experience </li><li>Expert knowledge in installing, configuring and administering database management systems, ETL and Data Quality software </li><li>Proven knowledge of data warehouse design methodologies, technical operations and project management skills </li><li>Strong knowledge of relational database management systems, data modeling, data analysis, logical and physical database design tools and techniques, and SQL procedural language </li><li>Experience in using InfoSphere family of products including Data Stage, Quality Stage, Information Analyzer and Data Governance Catalog. </li><li>Four or more years of experience developing extract, transform and load solutions with IBM WebSphere DataStage. </li><li>Experience working with IBM MDM.  </li><li>Strong understanding of multiple software development methodologies, as well as data modeling and XML </li></ul><p><strong>Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC.<br> <br></strong>Apply online by <strong>January 31, 2016</strong>.<br> <br>We thank all applicants for their interest in the Ontario Securities Commission. We will contact those selected for an interview.<br> <br>The OSC is committed to providing an inclusive workplace environment that meets the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities. Please go to Accessibility at the OSC to review the OSC’s policies on accessibility and accommodation in the workplace</p></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Ontario Securities Commission</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/2399?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/2399?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description"><p>The Ontario Securities Commission administers and enforces securities law in the province of Ontario. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Depuis 1984, Cisco est le chef de file de l’innovation en matière de technologies de réseaux basées sur les protocoles IP, comme le routage, la commutation, la sécurité, les communications unifiées, la vidéo et les communications sans fil. Cisco continue d’être le chef de file dans de nouveaux domaines comme l’infonuagique, les centres de données, la virtualisation, les réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN), l’Internet des objets, etc. Nos pratiques d’affaires socialement responsables permettent d’assurer la pérennité des activités et des produits, et ce, dans le respect de l’environnement.<br>Cisco est un chef de file mondial de 48 milliards de dollars qui offre les produits de réseau à la fine pointe qui alimentent l’Internet d’aujourd’hui. La société est l’un des meilleurs employeurs au monde; elle investit plus de 5 milliards de dollars par an en recherche et développement. Aujourd’hui, nous mettons sur pied des équipes qui étoffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilité, de l’infonuagique, de la sécurité, des technologies de l’information et du traitement des données volumineuses, y compris les logiciels et les services-conseils. À mesure que Cisco fournit les solutions de réseau qui optimisent l’Internet, nous relions entre eux les éléments qui ne l’étaient pas auparavant. Vos idées porteuses auront une incidence sur des domaines aussi variés que le commerce de détail, les secteurs de la santé et du divertissement, en passant par les secteurs publics et privés et bien d’autres. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Job Title:  Software Developer Intern, MS/PhD, Summer 2016   $%^& Company Name:  Google   $%^&   Job Location:  Montreal, QC, Canada   $%^&   Job Description:  Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.<br><br>As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.<br><br>Software Developers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our developers develop massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - which requires research, awareness, interactivity, and asking questions. You build strong competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a solid foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of developers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality. <br><br> As a Software Developer, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. Depending on your background and experience, you will be working in one of the following areas: <br><br><strong>Product and Systems Development</strong><br><br>Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers). <br><br><strong>Engineering Productivity</strong><br><br>As a software developer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated testsystems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best and brightest developers working in this group. <br><br><strong>Site Reliability</strong><br><br> Software developers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud-based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software developers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google - fast, reliable and accessible to all. <br><br>Responsibilities<br><ul> <li>Perform specific responsibilities which vary by project area</li> </ul><br>Minimum qualifications<br><ul> <li>Currently pursuing a Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science or related technical field.</li><li>Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.</li> </ul><br>Preferred qualifications<br><ul> <li>Experience in systems software or algorithms.</li> <li>Familiarity with TCP/IP and network programming.</li> <li>Knowledge of Unix/Linux or Windows environments and APIs.</li> <li>Excellent implementation skills (C++, Java, Python).</li> </ul><br>Area<br><br>Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.<br><br>Kitchener-Waterloo</div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Google</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/1441?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/1441?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Google is not a conventional company, and we don't intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world's most successful organizations - a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind - but even as we continue to grow, we're committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work.</div><div class="media"><object width="606" height="340" class="video-object"><param name="wmode" value="opaque"></param><param name="movie" value="https://www.youtube.com/v/eZHEnPCEe0o?modestbranding=1&rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><embed wmode="opaque" src="https://www.youtube.com/v/eZHEnPCEe0o?modestbranding=1&rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="606" height="340" allowFullScreen="true"></embed></object></div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div><div class="other-jobs"><h2>Other jobs at Google</h2><ul class="internal-jobs"><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/65657527?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">OSP Architect, Network Architecture, Google Fiber…</a><div class="location">Toronto, ON, Canada</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/97691673?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Test Engineer, Google Fiber</a><div class="location">Waterloo, ON, Canada</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/72851361?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Technical Lead/Manager</a><div class="location">Waterloo, ON, Canada</div></li></ul><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/google/careers?trk=job_view_company_see_more_jobs" class="see-more">View more jobs at Google</a></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  Electrical REVIT Operators   $%^& Company Name:  Stantec   $%^&   Job Location:  CA-ON-Toronto   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong>Your Opportunity:</strong> <br><br> We put the engine in buildings engineering. With decades of experience under our belts, we’re achieving remarkable results with our work in building technologies, energy, and environmental performance. Our team of interdisciplinary engineers works collaboratively with clients to design buildings and processes that are on track for safety, performance, and sustainability. <br><br> Join a dynamic team that balances competing project interests with creativity and efficiency for a smooth ride every time. Together, we can accelerate towards a brighter future. <br><br> Our downtown <strong>Toronto, ON</strong> office is looking for highly motivated <strong>REVIT Operators </strong>to work with a growing, multi-disciplinary practice in both public and private buildings projects ranging from educational to healthcare and commercial buildings. <br><br> <strong>Your Duties:</strong> <br><br>Reporting to the REVIT Lead, the successful candidate will be responsible for:<br><br><ul><li>Producing aspects of electrical design and drawings in REVIT,</li><li>Organizing and maintaining a design and REVIT digital file database for each project,</li><li>Successfully carrying out assignments on project design teams,</li><li>Undertaking drawings of power distribution, fire alarm systems, lighting, and/or instrumentation and control drawings of control panels and instrumentation systems</li><li>Facilitating and ensuring the quality of design, drawings and graphic work produced for the team.</li><li>Communicating during model production with other team members.</li><li>Understanding REVIT file structures and modifications to files for exchanges with other consultants.</li><li>Becoming familiar with modifying Avatech templates to specific projects.</li><li>Creating custom blocks (Families) using REVIT software per projects.</li><li>Becoming familiar with Stantec existing blocks (Families) and graphic standards.</li><li>Communicating with multi-discipline REVIT leaders on troubleshooting issues.</li></ul><br>Training will be provided to advance your skills in areas of detailed design.<br><br> <strong>Your Capabilities and Credentials:</strong> <br><br> <ul><li>A diploma from a Technical School specializing in Electrical Buildings design.</li><li>A minimum of 2 years’ experience with multi-discipline start-up coordination of REVIT.</li><li>Up to 3 years' experience in an electrical consulting engineering environment.</li><li>High REVIT MEP proficiency is essential. Depuis 1984, Cisco est le chef de file de l’innovation en matière de technologies de réseaux basées sur les protocoles IP, comme le routage, la commutation, la sécurité, les communications unifiées, la vidéo et les communications sans fil. Cisco continue d’être le chef de file dans de nouveaux domaines comme l’infonuagique, les centres de données, la virtualisation, les réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN), l’Internet des objets, etc. Nos pratiques d’affaires socialement responsables permettent d’assurer la pérennité des activités et des produits, et ce, dans le respect de l’environnement.<br>Cisco est un chef de file mondial de 48 milliards de dollars qui offre les produits de réseau à la fine pointe qui alimentent l’Internet d’aujourd’hui. La société est l’un des meilleurs employeurs au monde; elle investit plus de 5 milliards de dollars par an en recherche et développement. Cisco offre un lieu de choix où développer sa carrière.<br><br>L’équipe<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Le centre canadien de R et D situé à Ottawa en Ontario est à la recherche de développeurs de logiciels expérimentés. Le candidat retenu sera un membre actif de l’équipe de développement de logiciels et contribuera à la mise en œuvre, aux tests et à la livraison d’applications et de services d’avant-garde des plans de contrôle et de données notamment des protocoles tels que les protocoles de routage IPv4 et IPv6, MPLS, L2VPN/VPLS et de réseaux de diffusion de contenu (CDN) fondés sur des architectures de réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN) et de réseaux virtualisés. Nous sommes des pionniers et nous l’avons été dès les débuts de la connectivité. Aujourd’hui, nous mettons sur pied des équipes qui étoffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilité, de l’infonuagique, de la sécurité, des technologies de l’information et du traitement des données volumineuses, y compris les logiciels et les services-conseils. À mesure que Cisco fournit les solutions de réseau qui optimisent l’Internet, nous relions entre eux les éléments qui ne l’étaient pas auparavant. Imaginez si vous pouviez créer des idées qui changent le monde! Vos idées porteuses auront une incidence sur des domaines aussi variés que le commerce de détail, les secteurs de la santé et du divertissement, en passant par les secteurs publics et privés et bien d’autres. Collaborez avec des gens tournés vers l’innovation dans un environnement stimulant et une culture d’entreprise souple qui ont permis à Cisco d’être reconnue pour son milieu de travail exceptionnel. Environ 10 milliards d’objets sont actuellement connectés à l’échelle mondiale et il est prévu que plus de 50 milliards d’objets le seront dans le futur. C’est pourquoi au sein de Cisco, vous disposerez d’un nombre exponentiel de possibilités d’avancement.<br><li>LI-EMEA-DO1<br></li><strong>Type de poste: </strong>Expérimenté<br><strong>Catégories des offres d'emploi: </strong>Aucun<br><br></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Cisco</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO) enables people to make powerful connections--whether in business, education, philanthropy, or creativity. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Le candidat retenu sera un membre actif de l’équipe de développement de logiciels et contribuera à la mise en œuvre, aux tests et à la livraison d’applications et de services d’avant-garde des plans de contrôle et de données notamment des protocoles tels que les protocoles de routage IPv4 et IPv6, MPLS, L2VPN/VPLS et de réseaux de diffusion de contenu (CDN) fondés sur des architectures de réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN) et de réseaux virtualisés. Qualifications minimales<br><br>• Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en science informatique ou génie électrique ou informatique, ou une expérience équivalente exigés Toute autre compétence démontrée en haute technologie est recherchée<br>• Expérience de développement logiciel<br>• Expert du développement logiciel en utilisant Java, Python, Net Connaissance des fichiers Makefile, de l’analyse statique et des dépôts distants Habitué de travailler avec des outils tels que Visual Studio etc.<br>• Excellentes aptitudes de communication<br><br>Compétences recherchées<br>Expérience des méthodologies Agile/Scrum, un atout certain<br>• Expérience dans la conception de systèmes de commutation et de routage<br>• Expérience des protocoles des couches 2 et 3 Connaissance pratique des protocoles de mise en réseau TCP/IP<br>• Connaissance des technologies réseau dont MPLS, la multidiffusion, les RPV, la NAT, les analyses de qualité de service, AAA, les DNS et le protocole DHCP<br>• Connaissance des technologies de l’infonuagique de SDN, de NFV et de la virtualisation du réseau de virtualisation Virtualization<br>• Expérience directe avec Linux et le logiciel connexe d’infrastructure<br><br>À propos de Cisco<br><br>L’Internet multidimensionnel est un phénomène qui crée de nouveaux débouchés pour Cisco et qui transforme les activités de nos clients dans le monde entier. Nous sommes des pionniers et nous l’avons été dès les débuts de la connectivité. Aujourd’hui, nous mettons sur pied des équipes qui étoffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilité, de l’infonuagique, de la sécurité, des technologies de l’information et du traitement des données volumineuses, y compris les logiciels et les services-conseils. À mesure que Cisco fournit les solutions de réseau qui optimisent l’Internet, nous relions entre eux les éléments qui ne l’étaient pas auparavant. Imaginez si vous pouviez créer des idées qui changent le monde! Vos idées porteuses auront une incidence sur des domaines aussi variés que le commerce de détail, les secteurs de la santé et du divertissement, en passant par les secteurs publics et privés et bien d’autres. Collaborez avec des gens tournés vers l’innovation dans un environnement stimulant et une culture d’entreprise souple qui ont permis à Cisco d’être reconnue pour son milieu de travail exceptionnel. Environ 10 milliards d’objets sont actuellement connectés à l’échelle mondiale et il est prévu que plus de 50 milliards d’objets le seront dans le futur. C’est pourquoi au sein de Cisco, vous disposerez d’un nombre exponentiel de possibilités d’avancement.<br><li>LI-EMEA-DO1<br></li><strong>Type de poste: </strong>Expérimenté<br><strong>Catégories des offres d'emploi: </strong>Aucun<br><br></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Cisco</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO) enables people to make powerful connections--whether in business, education, philanthropy, or creativity. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Aujourd’hui, nous mettons sur pied des équipes qui étoffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilité, de l’infonuagique, de la sécurité, des technologies de l’information et du traitement massif des données, dont les logiciels et les services-conseils. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Job Title:  Director - Quality Assurance   $%^& Company Name:  Sysomos   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, ON   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>We are looking for an experienced hands-on technical QA Director to build and lead a distributed test engineering team.  The ideal candidate is passionate about building large-scale, mission-critical software and infrastructure in a fast-paced agile environment. <p></p></p><p>Our elite team is fast, innovative and flexible; with a weekly release cycle and individual ownership we expect great things from our engineers and their leaders and reward them with stimulating new projects, emerging technologies and the chance to have significant equity in a company that is about to change the cloud computing landscape forever. <p></p></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong> </p><ul><li>Responsible for planning, executing, managing and reporting for all testing and Engineering activities across the infrastructure, project and application portfolio. </li><li>Leads the Quality Engineering group through a clearly defined process-driven methodology to ensure project goals, QE standards, and internal best practices are routinely and meticulously <br> followed. </li><li>Manages QE Leads to ensure project / service delivery are accomplished in line with project /portfolio goals and Quality Engineering practices and standards. </li><li>Partners with Infrastructure, Business and Development teams to review business / technical requirements and guides and assists QE leads in generating comprehensive test strategy, plans, impact analysis and test cases for effective Engineering and testing functions. </li><li>Responsible for managing QE capacity and resources and scheduling QE activities and quality gates for the project portfolio. Responsible for managing the QE project portfolio. </li><li>Perform QE recruiting and vendor management activities. </li><li>Contribute to and define and establish new set of best-practices, processes, scorecards and tooling for Quality Engineering organization. This is to ensure that overall productivity and quality is measured at all times and improved in line with targeted milestones. </li><li>Serves as the Test Automation expert. Responsible for establishing a standards-based automation / performance testing competency with a robust testing framework, testing & test management tools, test data and test cases for key applications across the portfolio. </li><li>Responsible for developing and maintaining functional, end-to-end, performance and regression test suites that thoroughly cover all aspects of applications across the portfolio. </li><li>Plays a critical role in ensuring that impact analysis is conducted and reviewed thoroughly and consistently to ensure that right test cases to cover the right exposures are identified and reviewed with project stakeholders. </li><li>Publishes a standardized QE productivity as well as Project and Release Testing status reporting across all projects / applications on a weekly / recurring basis. </li><li>Acts as a critical resource in keeping production systems running smoothly and plays a pivotal role in all cutover, smoke testing, triaging and release activities. </li><li>Assumes ownership and governance of QE environment. This involves coordinating the refresh of databases, environments and review / approval of application build releases to QE environments and shakedown testing of these environments. </li><li>Responsible for all equipment, licensing and configuration in the QE lab environments and ensure that environments are available and properly configured for project needs. </li><li>Provides recommendations on new technologies, processes and / or procedures in pursuit of continuous improvement of the overall Quality Engineering function. </li><li>Provides ongoing training and guidance to the QE team on quality.</li></ul></div></div><div class="skills-section"><h3 class="sub-header">Desired Skills and Experience</h3><div class="rich-text"><ul><li>12+ years of software quality engineering experience with enterprise-class software or related </li><li>4+ years Management experience with automation and regression testing teams. </li><li>Proven track record in leading development of test automation strategy, tools and frameworks </li><li>Expert level, hands-on experience with Automation Testing Tools (Client QTP, Selenium, etc.) </li><li>Expert level, hands-on experience with performance testing tools (LoadRunner, AppLoader, etc.) </li><li>Strong hands-on experience with test planning and execution for UI as well as back-office systems that require Web services or batch based integrations and implementations. </li><li>In-depth software engineering and development lifecycle knowledge </li><li>Strong understanding of network and security design and the implication of these on the performance test environments; Ability to communicate with the infrastructure team to recommend alternative solutions for addressing application bottlenecks; </li><li>Strong management and leadership experience </li><li>Excellent verbal / written communication and influencing skills </li><li>Comfortable with fast-paced and schedule driven development</li></ul></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Sysomos</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/550605?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/550605?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description"><p>Sysomos is a world leader in social intelligence, offering a suite of powerful products that help companies measure and articulate social media success, harness the power of community and influencers, and find the conversations and topics online that matter most to their business. Job Title:  Ingénieur principal-test logiciel/Lead Software Test Eng.   $%^& Company Name:  GE Lighting   $%^&   Job Location:  Lachine, QC   $%^&   Job Description:  <p><strong>Role Summary/Purpose:</strong> <p></p></p><p>Joignez-vous à l’équipe Ingénierie des appareils intelligents de GE Éclairage au sein de laquelle vous aurez une influence directe sur comment le logiciel relie les appareils d’éclairage à DEL ajustables et leurs capteurs à l'internet. </p><p>  </p><p><strong>Essential Responsibilities:</strong> <p></p></p><p>Aidez à stimuler le développement et l’approche conceptuelle de futurs logiciels dans le but d’offrir aux utilisateurs la meilleure expérience possible de cette catégorie et les outils d’analyse requis pour une commande éconergétique de l’éclairage.Comme ingénieur principal des essais de logiciel, vous devrez:  </p><ul><li>Assumer la responsabilité de la qualité, des protocoles de test et de l’exécution des essais de plusieurs modules logiciels reliés entre eux pour former un système de commande.  </li><li>Comprendre le système actuel, proposer et développer des améliorations aux méthodes d’essai afin d’aller de l’avant.  </li><li>Maintenir et développer de nouveaux scripts de tests en utilisant des outils d’automation de tests Web Selenium ou en développant des scripts en langage Python, intégrer les scripts dans les test automatisés en utilisant Robot Framework.  </li><li>Analyser les critères de conception en vue de mettre au point et en application des outils automatisés pour les essais de régression et de performance.  </li><li>Recueillir les journaux et les données du système automatisé de Robot Frameworkou de la base de données PostgreSQL/MySQL, et développer des scénarios automatisés permettant de quantifier la performance et la stabilité.  </li><li>Tenir à jour en temps réel l’équipe de développement de logiciels afin d’assurer la résolution rapide des problèmes et l’amélioration du système.  </li><li>Déterminer les zones de faiblesse du système et formuler des stratégies d’amélioration.  </li></ul><p><br><br>Join the GE Lighting Intelligent Devices engineering team where you will have direct impact on how software connects controllable LED lighting and sensors to the "internet of things". Help drive future software development and design approach to deliver best-in-class user experience and analytics to energy saving lighting control. As a Lead Software Test Engineer, you will:  </p><ul><li>Be responsible for the quality, test plans, and test execution for multiple software modules connected in a control system.  </li><li>Understand current system, suggest and implement improvements for testing methodology going forward.   </li><li>Maintain and develop new test scripts using Selenium web automation tool, developing test scripts written in Python and integrate these scripts into existing Robot test Framework.  </li><li>Analyze design requirements to develop and implement automated tools for regression and performance testing.  </li><li>Collect logs and data from the Robot Framework automated test environment or from PostgreSQL/MySQL database, develop automated scripts for quantifying performance and stability.  </li><li>Provide real time feedback to software development team for quick resolution and system improvements.  </li><li>Diagnose areas of weakness in the system and formulate improvement plans.</li></ul></div></div><div class="skills-section"><h3 class="sub-header">Desired Skills and Experience</h3><div class="rich-text"><p><strong>Qualifications/Requirements:</strong> </p><ul><li>Baccalauréat en génie électrique ou informatique.  </li><li>Au minimum cinq années d’expérience en essais de logiciel – en s’assurant que la portée des essais respecte les spécifications, y compris de l’expérience de la mise en œuvre et/ou de l’extension d’outils d’automatisation commerciaux et/ou ouverts disponibles tels que Selenium, Robot Framework.  </li><li>Expérience de l’équipement d’essai, des protocoles de réseautage, des technologies RF et des systèmes point à multipoint.  </li><li>Expérience en test de logiciel d’image et de traitement vidéo, tel que playback, systèmes audio, codec, vision artificielle, édition vidéo.  </li><li>Maîtrise de l’utilisation de Linux et compétences en scripting permettant de recueillir les rapports et les données des bases de données PostgreSQL pour la mesure de la performance des opérations.   </li><li>Maitrise du langage Python. Experience avec un autre langage orienté objet un atout.  </li><li>Expérience en essais de services Web (SOAP / REST; débit de traitement, performance en action, etc.). </li><li>Connaissance pratique de Rally ou de tout autre système de gestion des bogues. </li><li>Excellentes habiletés en communication et en analyse.  </li><li>Personnalité énergique, autodidacte et motivée, en mesure d’adopter et de comprendre rapidement les nouvelles technologies.  </li><li>Aptitude à travailler simultanément sur plusieurs affectations et à produire des résultats de haute qualité.  </li><li>Compétences marquées en résolution de problèmes et en analyse, se manifestant par une capacité d’assimiler de nouvelles informations et de comprendre des sujets complexes. <p><br> </p></li></ul><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering.  </li><li>Minimum 5 years of software testing, insuring test coverage against specification, including experience implementing and/or extending commercial and/or open-source available automation tools such as Selenium, Robot Framework.  </li><li>Experience with test equipment, networking protocols, RF technologies, and point-to-multi-point systems.  </li><li>Prior software testing experience in image and video processing industry, such as playback engine, audio system, codec, computer vision, video editing.  </li><li>Strong Linux user and scripting skills to collect logs and data from PostgreSQL databases for operational and performance measurement. </li><li>Strong working knowledge of Python. Job Title:  Software Developer   $%^& Company Name:  iQmetrix   $%^&   Job Location:  Vancouver   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>iQmetrix is always looking for talented software developers. Whatever your particular areas of interest or your amount of experience, if you’re a great developer, we want you and we’ll find a role that fits. We’d much rather hire the right people when they come along than limit ourselves based on when we have a pressing need. </p><p><strong> </strong> </p><p><strong>What is development like at iQmetrix?</strong> </p><ul><li>We are first and foremost passionate about software development. We are continuous learners and work together to make each other better every day. We pair program and believe that close collaboration is the best way to share knowledge. </li><li>We require excellent problem-solving skills but not just to solve problems. We find the <em>right</em> solution, not just the first one we come up with. </li><li>Most of our developers have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, but skills and abilities come first. </li><li>Communication is key. We work in multi-disciplinary teams and most communication is verbal. The formal documentation we do have is a result of these verbal conversations. </li><li>To create high quality software, we write clean, extensible, S.O.L.I.D. object-oriented code and use techniques like Test-Driven Development and Continuous Deployment to ensure that we sustain our velocity over time. </li><li>Delivering value to our customers is our top priority and we look for devs with a strong bias for action. We strive for excellence, but don’t let “perfect” get in the way of moving forward. </li><li>We automate everything that moves, to transition from coding to deployment to production as quickly and as often as possible. </li><li>Our systems are based on a distributed, micro-service architecture. We build REST APIs, leverage Azure Service Bus and ØMQ to build highly scalable and efficient products. </li><li>Our web apps are built as single page apps using modern JavaScript tools and frameworks such as Backbone.js, Bootstrap and gulp. </li><li>Tools like Git, ReSharper and Postman allow us to move quickly and don’t get in the way. Our dev teams use open source tools a lot; we’ve contributed to several open source projects including NancyFx and NetMQ. </li></ul><p><strong>Application Process</strong> </p><p>If you are interested in joining our company and are committed to succeeding, please submit your resume and cover letter. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. </p><p> </p></div></div><div class="skills-section"><h3 class="sub-header">Desired Skills and Experience</h3><div class="rich-text"><p><strong>Skills</strong> </p><p>We’re not big fans of giant lists of skills, but search engines require job postings to have them. Job Title:  Manager, Scientific Research and Experimental Development    $%^& Company Name:  Ryan   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, Canada Area   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>Manager, Scientific Research and Experimental Development ("SR&ED") is responsible for assisting clients in identifying and claiming SR&ED tax credits and then assisting the SR&ED Director in defending those credits when necessary in the context of a review by the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA). The work is project-based and sometimes requires the team to spend time onsite at client facilities, working with engineers and technical personnel. This role includes performing and supervising tasks such as researching tax law, documenting expense treatment, and completing detailed models and calculations. </p><p>  </p><p>Duties and Responsibilities: </p><ul><li>Interviews clients, uncovering all SR&ED eligible projects and all information required to prepare the T661 filing. </li><li>Prepares the technical narratives for SR&ED tax credit claims of clients. This will also include the identification of specific employees, subcontractors and material expended in connection with the eligible activities identified, and determining the amount of effort relating thereto. </li><li>Ensures all claims are prepared, signed off by the SR&ED Director and the clients, and completed for CRA filing within 45 days of the initial technical meeting. </li><li>Advises and supports clients before and during any CRA technical review for SR&ED tax credit claims, and responds to correspondence that is initiated by CRA arguing technology aspects of the submitted SR&ED claim, if any. </li><li>Records all client interviews and saves the recordings in Ryan’s central file service. </li><li>Gathers samples of client supporting documents as claim(s) are prepared. </li><li>Participates in sales activities and attends, from time to time, in sales and business development meetings with the firm’s SR&ED practice Principal and business development professionals. </li><li>Collaborates with the firm’s key technical advisors on an ongoing development of the firm’s tools for preparing SR&ED claims. </li><li>Tracks time by client and activity codes. </li><li>Assists the practice Principal in preparing client presentations for proposals, planning strategies, and ideas. </li><li>Assists the SR&ED Director in developing project work plans and scheduling associated project deliverables. </li><li>Performs other duties as assigned.<p> </p></li></ul><p>Education and Experience: </p><p>Bachelor's or Master's degree in IT, Software Development, Engineering (Chemical, Mechanical, Industrial, Electrical or related disciplines) or Science, related industry experience, and a minimum two years of SR&ED tax credit experience required. Must have excellent organization and time management skills, strong communication skills, and willingness to learn and be a team player. <p></p></p><p>Computer Skills: </p><p>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be proficient in Microsoft® Excel and have a working knowledge of Microsoft® Word, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Internet navigation and research. <p></p></p><p>Certificates and Licenses: </p><p>Valid driver’s license required. <p></p></p><p>Supervisory Responsibilities: </p><p>This position may require supervisory responsibilities, including training peers and checking work for accuracy and completeness.</p></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Ryan</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/11070?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/11070?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description"><p>Ryan is an award-winning global tax services firm, with the largest indirect and property tax practices in North America and the sixth largest corporate tax practice in the United States. Job Title:  Sales Engineer   $%^& Company Name:  Vision Critical   $%^&   Job Location:  CA-ON-Toronto   $%^&   Job Description:  <p><strong>Company Background</strong> <br><br>Vision Critical provides a cloud-based customer intelligence platform that allows companies to build engaged, secure communities of customers they can use continuously, across the enterprise, for ongoing, real-time feedback and insight. Designed for today’s always-on, social and mobile savvy customer, Vision Critical’s technology helps large, customer-centric enterprises discover what their customers want so they can deliver what they need. Unlike traditional customer research, which is slow, expensive and gathers dust on a shelf, Vision Critical’s customer intelligence platform replaces static data and cumbersome reports with real-time actionable customer intelligence that companies need to build better products, deliver better services and achieve better business outcomes.<br> <br>This is a great opportunity to launch a successful and rewarding career in an award-winning global company, learning from some of the best professionals in the industry and engaging with co-workers and clients around the world. The potential for career development within our organization is endless. Join our team!<br> <br><strong>Role Description</strong> <br><br>As a member of our rockstar Sales team, the Sales Engineer will be the primary technical resource for all business development activities. You will be responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage during the RFP process, and conducting product demos to wow potential clients with the capabilities of our software. In this role, in partnership with the IT team, you will also be responsible for establishing and documenting technology standards, and be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users.<br> <br>As a Sales Engineer, your role is to act as a trusted advisor to our Sales team and make them more efficient. You will be part of a team that is the go-to for all product questions. We have a good-sized, experienced and active sales-force so the ability to keep track of multiple balls in the air is a “must-have” for this role.<br> <br><strong>Responsibilities</strong> </p><ul><li>Collaborates with Sales Teams to identify and uncover prospect and customer business goals, needs and pains </li><li>Maps the prospect’s business and technical needs to Vision Critical’s solutions and integrates the technical narrative into the larger VC story being delivered to the client </li><li>Provides pre-sales technical expertise through technical and product demonstrations, presentations and on-going technical consultation, again reinforcing the VC story </li><li>Qualifies the prospect’s technical team to understand who can help the sale, who can hinder the sale and who can provide relevant background information </li><li>Identifies opportunities for data and business system integration to enhance platform stickiness </li><li>Builds working knowledge of competing products (both direct and adjacent) and how to technically sell against them </li><li>Work collaboratively with Product Management and Product Marketing during the development, launch and continuing refinement of existing and new VC products and solutions </li><li>Responsible for representing the product to customers and at field events such as conferences, seminars, etc. </li><li>Able to respond to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs </li><li>Provide training for new customers where required </li></ul><p><strong>Requirements</strong> </p><ul><li>3-5+ years of experience in a similar role in a software company </li><li>Degree in Computer Science or a related field is an asset but not required </li><li>Ability to meet tight deadlines – do what it takes to get’er done </li><li>Strong presentation skills – you can hold the attention of any room – whether you are in front of them or via web meeting! As an integral part of the Canada Post Group of Companies, we understand our sister companies’ business opportunities and challenges. We use this understanding to develop solutions and services that drive synergies, efficiencies and cost savings across the Group. Our work transforms the Group’s operations and modernizes their business to meet the demands of the evolving mail, courier, and logistics industries.<br> <br>Our colleagues balance dedication, professionalism, and a private-sector approach to doing business with ample opportunity for career development and culture and team building.
