including AT&T, BT, Cable & Wireless, CenturyLink, Comcast, France Telecom, Korea Telecom, Sprint, Reliance, Southern Cross, Tata Communications, Telecom Argentina, Telmex, Virgin Media and Verizon. <br><br>Ciena also counts numerous national research and education networks as customers, as well as enterprises in the healthcare, finance, transportation and retail industries for real-time, latency sensitive applications such as disaster recovery/business continuity, SAN/LAN extension, data center consolidation and grid computing. <br><br>We specialize in helping customers transition to service driven networks that fundamentally change the way they compete. With expertise in optical and Ethernet networking, Ciena combines software-programmable hardware, a common operating system, and unified service and transport management to enable our customers to adapt and scale with any emergent business model. <br><br>For more visit www.ciena.com or subscribe to our blog and other communications channels at www.ciena.com/subscribe</div><div class="media"><object width="606" height="340" class="video-object"><param name="wmode" value="opaque"></param><param name="movie" value="https://www.youtube.com/v/tynp7Jy5d_8?modestbranding=1&rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><embed wmode="opaque" src="https://www.youtube.com/v/tynp7Jy5d_8?modestbranding=1&rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="606" height="340" allowFullScreen="true"></embed></object></div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div><div class="other-jobs"><h2>Other jobs at Ciena</h2><ul class="internal-jobs"><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/93853316?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Software Engineer, Packet Networking, R&D - New Grad</a><div class="location">Ottawa, , Canada</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/99680172?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Optical Solution Modelling - Intern/Co-op</a><div class="location">Ottawa, , Canada</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/83993476?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Software Designer - Intern/Co-op (5 Positions…</a><div class="location">Ottawa, , Canada</div></li></ul><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/ciena/careers?trk=job_view_company_see_more_jobs" class="see-more">View more jobs at Ciena</a></div></div></div><div class="

Job Title:  Solutions Architect   $%^& Company Name:  Travelers   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, CA   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong>Job Opening ID</strong> 5213BR <br> <strong>Title</strong> Solutions Architect <br> <strong>Country</strong> Canada <br> <strong>State/Region/Province</strong> Ontario <br> <strong>City</strong> Toronto <br> <strong>Job Category</strong> Information Systems <br> <strong>Position Type</strong> Experienced/Professional <br> <strong>Company Information</strong> <br> Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference. <br><br> <strong>Job Summary</strong> The Solutions Architecture team defines the architectural direction to ensure the appropriate and effective use of technology to support immediate and long term business needs. The team of highly motivated architects apply their domain expertise as they lead and participate in strategy development, environmental analysis, opportunity identification, and solution architecture and design. <br><br>The Solution Architect is responsible for the leadership, analysis and design tasks related to the development of enterprise solution architecture. You will work with a range of people in business and IT as you lead and facilitate the development and use of our target solutions. As a member of the Solutions Architecture team you contribute to the development of all styles and patterns of architecture solutions. You are a seasoned systems professional who brings P&C insurance knowledge and solutions design experience to bear as you develop architecture assets. You have developed architecture solutions to address complex needs of the organisation, preferably at the enterprise level. <br><br> Your experience includes developing road maps that contribute to the evolution of the enterprise application portfolio from current to future state (as defined by the target architecture). You have coordinated solution architecture implementation and modification activities. You have facilitated the evaluation and selection of software product standards, as well as the design of standard software configurations. A team player, you consult with application or infrastructure development teams to fit systems or infrastructure to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify the solution architecture to accommodate project needs. You understand that successful architectures bring value at an appropriate cost to the organization and as a result you identify the organizational impact (for example, on skills, processes, structures or culture) and financial impact of the target architecture. You appreciate the value of communicating the architecture and use your strong communication skills to verbalise and document all solution architecture design and analysis work. Your information solutions include checks and controls to ensure proper governance, security and quality of information assets. <br><br> You are results-oriented and leverage consultative, collaborative, and facilitation skills to glean enterprise direction from a diverse audience both internal and external to the organisation (vendors, business sponsors and SMEs, business analysts, peer architects). You are excited by new approaches in architecture and will leverage your hands-on experience and apply practical approaches to introduce change to the organisation. <br><br> <strong>Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities</strong> <ul><li> Determines, evaluates and defines the appropriate architectural strategy to align departmental/corporate business objectives with information technology strategies, placing high importance on the overall cost of ownership and investment for the future. </li><li> Lead and guides the definition of technology based business solutions ensuring the appropriate and effective use of technology as a means for attaining business value. </li><li> Establishes technical direction and ensures solutions are consistent with architectural direction and consist of approved technologies and reusable assets. </li><li> Researches and evaluates emerging and maturing technologies to facilitate the identification, introduction and exploitation of technologies for departmental and corporate solutions. </li><li> Provides coaching, mentoring and consulting to raise the overall technical competency of staff and to disseminate an understanding of the architecture direction. </li><li> Identifies opportunities for Information Services to ensure high quality in all deliverables and continuous improvement in solution definition and delivery. roadmaps while driving architectural recommendations </li><li> Demonstrated ability to communicate new concepts, ideas, techniques, best practices and technology </li><li> Demonstrated ability to work with vendors and application owners to establish required infrastructures and frameworks </li><li> Demonstrated ability to translate strategic requirements into reusable enterprise solution architecture. </li><li> Demonstrated ability to evaluate and assess architectural adherence through blueprint and design reviews </li><li> Knowledgeable in the design and construction of solution class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Gevity</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Welcome to Gevity.<br><br>For the past 20 years you have known us as Global Village Consulting. During that time we have changed, evolved and expanded, in part through organic growth and in part through mergers with other firms that have shared our values, our ethos and our focus on the health and social services market.<br><br>The time had come to review our brand image to ensure it builds on who we were, respects who we are now and incorporates who we aim to be in the future as we pursue a broader array of opportunities in markets around the world. <br><br>Our new company name, Gevity, is a play on “longevity” expressing our ongoing commitment to our values and to our mission of supporting healthier lives through connected systems. We are the same people with a new name!<br><br>Gevity is the new name in global health informatics. Gevity is an informatics and management consulting company offering a full range of professional services to clients seeking to build sustainable and effective health and social services systems. Through our focus on the unique needs of the health and social service sectors, we work to support healthier lives through connected systems. Our growing network of branch offices offers a unique combination of local expertise with global know-how.<br><br>Our services range from strategic consultancy, through policy, to systems integration. Our staff augmentation service offers a full complement of staffing across all clinical informatics and traditional IT/IS disciplines. Our consulting services teams are experts in program and project management, change management, facilitation and consensus building, health standards and architectures, as well as several health system perspectives. These perspectives including Primary Care, Hospitals, Public Health, Laboratory Medicine, Medication Management, and large-scale health analytics to name a few.<br><br>Please do not hesitate to contact us to discuss your challenges and needs – we want to be part of your solution.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  Cloud Project Manager   $%^& Company Name:  Genesys   $%^&   Job Location:  Markham, Ontario, Canada   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong>YOU MUST HAVE CLOUD DEPLOYMENT EXPERIENCE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE. NO OTHER APPLICANTS WILL BE CONSIDERED</strong><br><br>The Cloud Project Manager owns the overall lifecycle of Cloud projects, including planning and execution of the initial deployment release and post-deployment release cycles. In this role, the Senior Cloud Project Manager closely coordinates work between the Engineering, Operations, Professional Services, Customer Care, and Provisioning teams and ultimately owns the success of SaaS projects.<br><br>Responsible for managing a portfolio of multiple simultaneous deployment and post-deployment releases, creating corresponding project plans, and organizing resources across different functions according to business priorities. Expected to work in a dynamic environment with frequently changing priorities, schedule and scope boundaries, and limited resources. Required to find non-standard solutions to critical project situations on a daily basis. Expected to be an expert self-reliant project manager capable of working with a highly distributed global team, and make effective decisions under high levels of stress and with significant constraints.<br><br>Also responsible for contributing to more efficient project management and cloud processes to elevate the overall discipline of cloud project management to higher levels of organizational maturity. <br><br><strong>Responsibilities</strong><br><br> <ul> <li>Manage portfolio of assigned deployment projects, forecast resource needs, coordinate long term plans to achieve most optimal alignment</li> <li>Work with Professional Services Project Manager to initiate project plans for new deployments, determine resource needs, and identify critical dependencies and risks</li> <li>Work with Engineering, Provisioning, and Operations organizations to plan and obtain resources necessary for implementation of the deployment</li> <li>Ensure comprehensive review of the business requirements with Engineering and Operations organizations with the goal of matching them to the standard capabilities of the Cloud Platform and identifying exceptions requiring custom deliverables from Engineering. Plan, manage, and track all additional deliverables identified during the planning phase</li> <li>Organize and manage with Operations the build of the Cloud Platform according to the scope and schedule determined by the deployment project plan</li> <li>Organize the work of the Provisioning team to implement the scope of configuration and provisioning activities in the deployment project plan, validate them according to the test plan, and hand over to the customer for User Acceptance Testing</li> <li>Organize day to day tracking of deployment activities, manage risks and dependencies, eliminate blockers for the Provisioning team, and manage changes in scope and schedule</li> <li>Own and maintain deployment project infrastructure using existing tools providing all necessary metrics for reporting and status updates</li> <li>Work with Professional Services Project Manager on the deployment rollout plan and be responsible for all critical deliverables from Engineering and Operations organizations</li> <li>After the initial deployment, work with the customer account team and Customer Care organization to establish pipeline of post-deployment activities and execute them in iterative cycles according to the order of priorities agreed with the customer</li> <li>Participate in organizing software upgrades and critical issues resolution in customer deployments</li> </ul> <br><br><strong>Required Qualifications</strong><br><br> <ul> <li>Minimum 5-7 years of project management experience with 3-5 years managing SaaS projects</li> <li>Must have Project management certification (PMP and/or CSM preferred).</li> <li>Knowledge of IT service delivery lifecycle</li> <li>Knowledge of Agile methodologies</li> <li>Must have good organizational skills and the ability to work independently, efficiently, and effectively in a high-volume, fast-paced environment with multiple constraints and under high levels of stress</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Excellent organizational and time management skills</li> <li>Knowledge of the Atlassian Productivity Suite (Jira, Confluence), familiarity with its advanced features and ability to customize it for most efficient use in deployment projects</li> <li>Expert knowledge of productivity tools (Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, Power Point) required</li> <li>Must have good interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with co-workers within and across departments, time zones and cultures</li> <li>Must be a team player</li> </ul> <br><br><strong>Preferred Capabilities</strong><br><br> <ul> <li>Knowledge of the IT Service Delivery Frameworks (such as ITIL) and ability to apply them in SaaS environments</li> <li>Knowledge of the Contact Center Telephony domain area</li> <li>Knowledge of process improvement methodologies and frameworks</li> <li>Strong negotiation and leadership skills</li> <li>Experience in a DevOps culture</li> <li>Knowledge of SaaS technical environments</li> </ul> <br><br>Genesys is a leading provider of multi-channel customer experience and contact center solutions. With over 3,500 customers in 80 countries, Genesys orchestrates more than 100 million customer interactions every day across the contact center and back office. Genesys helps customers power optimal customer experiences that deliver consistent, seamless and personalized experiences across all touchpoints, channels and interactions.<br><br><strong>Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics</strong></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Genesys</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/601919?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/601919?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Genesys is the market leader in multi-channel customer experience (CX) and contact center solutions in the cloud and on-premises. CESs use proprietary systems and tools to program and test the pension calculation system and help validate, verify, communicate, and resolve systems/software application issues.<br><br><strong>Responsibility Areas <br></strong><ul><li>Review and analyze Calc Engine analysis specifications, business requirements and plan provisions to prepare for configuration of system. </li><li>Complete written methodology detailing steps to be included in the coding of calcalations.</li><li>Program/code Calc Engine system to meet analysis specifications. Perform informal testing of code to ensure the majority of the population is considered.</li><li>Create and execute test scripts, cases, and scenarios to ensure applications meet business requirements fulfill end-user requirements, and identify systems issues.</li><li>Analyze formal test results in order to discover and resolve defects, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws. </li><li>Produce and maintain reports and documentation for configuration analysis, technical specifications, and testing activities. </li><li>Provide ongoing support and maintenance of Calc Engine system. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Formal Education & Certification <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree (with preferred concentrations in Math, Actuarial Science, Finance, Computer Science, MIS) or equivalent work experience. </li><li>0-3 years related work experience preferred. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge & Experience <br></strong><ul><li>Exposure to system testing and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies. </li><li>Experience with testing methodologies and tools. </li><li>Exposure to project-based work structures. </li><li>Ability to interpret and understand conditional statements (i.e., If/Then/Else) and debug complex calculations in Excel spreadsheets. </li><li>Knowledge of basic System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles. </li><li>Ability to troubleshoot system defects and errors. <br><br></li></ul>Aon offers competitive compensation, exceptional benefits, continuing education & training, a unique internal advancement program, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.<br><br>All positions at Aon require an applicant who has accepted an offer to undergo a background check. The checks run are based on the nature of the position. Background checks may include some or all of the following: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that you will be required to undergo a background check should you be made an offer. You also understand that the offer is contingent upon successful completion of the background check and results consistent with Aon's employment policies. TD also ranks among the world’s leading online financial services firms, with approximately 9.7 million active online and mobile customers. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges under the symbol "TD".<br><br> Department Overview <br> Wealth Operations & Technology is the operational engine of TD Wealth supporting all advisory channels under the Wealth banner, TD Asset Management and TD Securities. Job Title:  Database and Technology Account Executive   $%^& Company Name:  Sotalex   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>As a quota-based Database & Technology Account Executive, you will develop a strategy and execute a sales plan resulting in license sales revenue wins with new accounts. </p><p>  </p><p>At a product level, you must develop and maintain an awareness of our client's current and future Database and Technology products, acting as a knowledgeable resource for customers. The Account Executive must be able to articulate our client's value proposition within the competitive landscape of relational, columnar and in-memory database technologies. The Account Executive will need to understand how database integration and quality solutions add value to an enterprise IT landscape. This individual will also need to understand how these technologies tie into a larger enterprise portfolio ranging from master data management to enterprise portals and business applications. </p><p>  </p><p>The Account Executive will be focused on driving innovation into the customer base, in addition to upgrading any existing installed software. A key component of the success of this role relies upon your ability to learn and articulate how the full offering drives innovation into the customer, in order to improve revenue, margin and market position. Accredited to develop standards in the U.S. and Canada, we have developed more than 3,000 codes and standards in a wide range of subject areas that speak to product safety and performance, process improvement, best practices and safer work environments. Manager provides direction and leadership for their respective project(s), is responsible for ensuring cohesive and consistent program delivery on time, on budget, on target, with a successful team and to the client’s satisfaction within established quality standards.  The Project Manager is responsible for leading the project planning, implementation and close-out processes while managing various project deliverables. </p><p>  </p><p>As an energy efficiency specialist at Summerhill, responsibilities may include, but not limited to: </p><ol><li>Conducting ASHRAE Level 1 or 2 audits; </li><li>Providing technical energy management expertise to the project management and business development teams; </li><li>Training field staff to support with basic home energy auditing and reporting; </li><li>Proactive integration of field reporting and scheduling software tools; </li><li>Ensure high quality completion of incentive applications. </li></ol><p>  </p><p><strong>Accountability & Reporting:</strong> </p><p>This role reports to the Senior Director, Program Operations.  Project Managers are typically supported by project staff and other Summerhill personnel.  This support team may include: project coordinator(s), call centre and field based staff persons. <p></p></p><p><strong>Project Management Responsibilities:</strong> </p><ol><li>Creates and executes project work plans and revises as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements. </li><li>Identifies resources needed and assigns individual responsibilities. </li><li>Manages day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope. </li><li>Reviews deliverables prepared by team before passing to client (internal or external clients). </li><li>Effectively applies Summerhill methodology and enforces project quality standards. </li><li>Minimizes organizational exposure and risk on project(s). </li><li>Ensures project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately. </li><li>Ensures project learnings and outcomes are captured and reported for future reference. </li></ol><p>Project Accounting </p><ol><li>Understands basic revenue models, P/L, and cost-to-completion projections and makes decisions accordingly. </li><li>Ensures project legal documents are completed and signed. </li><li>Manages project budget, including monthly review and reconciliation. </li><li>Understands project pricing model and billing procedures. </li><li>Ensures timely and accurate invoicing, and monitors project receivables. </li></ol><p>Business Development </p><ol><li>Identifies business development and "add-on" sales opportunities as they relate to a specific project. </li><li>Shares opportunities for project or client growth with appropriate team members. </li><li>Effectively conveys corporate message in both written and verbal business development discussions. </li><li>Develops project budgets for new project design based on knowledge of delivery and resource requirements. </li></ol><p>Communication </p><ol><li>Facilitates team and client meetings effectively. </li><li>Holds regular status meetings with project team. </li><li>Keeps project team well informed of changes to project scope and plan. </li><li>Effectively communicates relevant project information to project stakeholders, internal and external clients. </li><li>Delivers engaging, informative, well-organized presentations. </li><li>Resolves and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion. </li><li>Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully. </li></ol><p>Stakeholder Management </p><ol><li>Manages day-to-day interaction with project stakeholders (internal and external customers, vendors and other interested parties). familiarity with relevant provincial residential and commercial incentive programs. </li></ul><p> Interested applicants please submit cover letters and resumes to resumes@baystreethr.com ensuring to A key element of the Project Manager role is to ensure that processes and procedures are adhered to, and that the timelines of projects are achieved within the defined budget.<br><br><strong><u>The Project Manager Will Be Responsible For<br><br></u></strong>• The management of standards development activities in existing areas, as well as conducting business development initiatives to expand the portfolio into new areas of the Energy and Sustainability Programs (specifically, the Petroleum and Natural Gas sector).<br>• Overseeing all aspects of the standards development process, primarily involving the management of multiple Canadian and/or international standards development committees.<br>• Identifying project timelines and budgets in accordance with CSA Directives. Identify and pursue potential areas of new business opportunities (e.g. new standards requirements, training and education programs) related to the core business of CSA Standards.<br>• Establishing timelines for project activities, determining project resource requirements (e.g. funding, personnel support), and assembling overall project schedules.<br>• Day-to-day management of committee activities, delivering on project milestones and revenue targets.<br>• Execution of CSA Directives related to projects (e.g. ensuring a balanced matrix of Technical Committee membership).<br>• Recommending to Chair and Vice-Chair regarding methods to improve/enhance Technical Committee performance.<br>• Management of committee membership changes, working with Chair and Vice-Chair to recruit new members. Participating in new projects and/or development of new products. Identifying and pursuing business development opportunities.<br>• Liaising with clients, management, Legal and Finance to compose proposals, contracts, and financial analysis for new projects.<br><br><strong><u>Education<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor’s Degree in an appropriate field<br><br><strong><u>Skills & Experience<br><br></u></strong>• 10+ year’s relevant experience, with 3-5 years’ experience in Standards Development or Project Management<br>• Excellent Project Management, Organizational and Planning skills<br>• Experience in the Energy/Engineering or Oil/Gas Industry would be an asset<br>• Knowledge of the standards industry, government policy, industry landscape, and funding programs/models would be an asset<br>• Experience writing proposals, business plans, planning skills<br>• Strong ability to network, manage relationships, identify opportunities, and win new business<br>• Strong leadership, decision making and negotiation skills<br>• High degree of self-motivation, resilience, adaptability and flexibility<br>• Developed computer skills (word processing, presentation software, project planning software, excel etc)<br>• Highly developed oral, facilitation and communication skills<br><br>Travel: (frequent)<br><br>CSA Group provides a dynamic working environment that is both challenging and stable. The CSA Group certification mark appears on more than a billion products around the world and our broad range of product certification knowledge and expertise includes: industrial equipment, plumbing & construction, electro-medical & healthcare, appliances & gas, alternative energy, lighting and sustainability. Accredited to develop standards in the U.S. and Canada, we have developed more than 3,000 codes and standards in a wide range of subject areas that speak to product safety and performance, process improvement, best practices and safer work environments. We employ more than 1,500 professionals and maintain a community of 8,000 dedicated volunteer members working on over 1,300 standards development committees helping to make the world a better, safer, more sustainable place.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Data-driven insight and control is then delivered ‘Live’ to employees through a mobile experience.<br><br>Continuous monitoring balances just-in-time availability with employee needs and peak utilization targets. Work(Smart) enables managers to effect workplace policy while allowing employees to self-identify, self-organize and self-manage space around work objectives.<br><br>Work(Smart) combines software, data and technology across the Internet of Things (IoT), including smart sensors, wireless services, secure cloud networks, advanced occupancy algorithms and mobile visualization to transform digital intelligence into actionable services or control. <br><br>Work(Smart) includes:<br><br>•	Work(Space)	digital representation of live occupancy data for planning and design<br>•	Work(Flow) digital representation of live work activity throughout a workspace<br>•	Work(Flex) transformation and mobile management tools for elastic space<br>•	Work(Waze) Live assignment, verification and release of work space and resources<br><br>Work(Smart) is simple, secure, scalable and success-based. It does not require integration into enterprise networks or power distribution. It grows when you grow, either in scope or scale. Work(Smart) is open, providing interoperability between other enterprise data sources and IWMS/CAFM data repositories if desired.<br><br>Work(Smart) by UtiLive is the first solution to incorporate people, space and time into a single service with actionable controls that increase workplace effectiveness and return. Job Title:  Data Center Systems Engineer   $%^& Company Name:  Shopify   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, CA   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong><u>Listing Info<br><br></u></strong>Shopify is powered by a fleet of thousands of servers across multiple datacenters, and continues to grow at a near exponential rate. Bringing full racks of new servers online, old servers offline, and keeping our current generation humming along is vital to maintaining uninterrupted, blazing fast service to our merchants and their customers. As we expand globally, were looking for hardware-oriented metal heads and low-stack or full stack developers to power and tool-up our metal cloud. This is an exciting opportunity to break new ground on an automation driven team.<br><br><strong><u>You'll Be Working On<br><br></u></strong>The tools to automatically bootstrap, image, plan, and keep track of our datacenter assets. The vision of our team is to model all hardware with a software abstraction to automate common network and server tasks, and deliver self-service access to our engineers. The end game will be a system that can automatically bootstrap and configure all switches and servers in a new datacenter, and then continue to manage the entire lifecycle of all equipment and components. Through chatops tools like Lita and Hubot, developers will use our tooling to re-image, reboot, and debug servers.<br>You'll need to have: <ul><li>A complete obsession with automation and simplicity</li><li>An unquenchable thirst for knowledge, actively and independently learning new things</li><li>Worked with a mature, production web application stack before</li></ul> It would be great if you have: <ul><li>A passionate interest in low-level systems, especially Linux internals</li><li>Built your own home computer or server, and enjoyed it</li><li>Been to or worked in a datacenter before</li><li>Detailed knowledge of computer systems and the OSI stack</li><li>Some idea of how packets flow through a network, below the socket layer</li><li>Heard of and hopefully used something like Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible for system configuration and automation</li><li>Developed or supported a Ruby on Rails stack or application</li><li>Built something with Sinatra, NodeJS, Lita, Hubot or similar</li><li>Used iPXE, BOOTP, PXELINUX and other network booting technologies</li><li>Worked with networking equipment beyond a home or office router, ideally Arista or Juniper.</li></ul> Projects to check out: <ul><li> http://shopify.github.io/ - Shopifys compendium of open source projects</li><li> https://github.com/Shopify/shipit-engine - our automated deployment framework</li><li> https://github.com/Shopify/zygote-gem - our iPXE automation framework</li><li> https://github.com/Shopify/linecook-gem - Linux system image generation framework<br></li></ul>If any of the above resonates with you, be sure to hit apply and hit up Dale Hamel in the additional info section. worldwide provider of network security appliances and the market leader in unified threat management (UTM). Our products and subscription services provide broad, integrated and high-performance protection against dynamic security threats while simplifying the IT security infrastructure. Our customers include enterprises, service providers and government entities worldwide, including the majority of the 2010 Fortune Global 100. Fortinet’s flagship FortiGate product delivers ASIC-accelerated performance and integrates multiple layers of security designed to help protect against application and network threats. Fortinet’s broad product line goes beyond UTM to help secure the extended enterprise – from endpoints, to the perimeter and the core, including databases and applications. Fortinet is headquartered in Sunnyvale, Calif., with offices around the world. </p><p>  </p><p>Please visit the following links to find additional information about our products and job opportunities.  </p><p>  </p><p>http://www.fortinet.com/ </p><p>  </p><p>http://jobs.fortinet.com/</p></div><div class="media"><object width="606" height="340" class="video-object"><param name="wmode" value="opaque"></param><param name="movie" value="https://www.youtube.com/v/SUryK5b8wt4?modestbranding=1&rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><embed wmode="opaque" src="https://www.youtube.com/v/SUryK5b8wt4?modestbranding=1&rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="606" height="340" allowFullScreen="true"></embed></object></div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div><div class="other-jobs"><h2>Other jobs at Fortinet</h2><ul class="internal-jobs"><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/95588220?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Graphic Designer</a><div class="location">Burnaby</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/95588404?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Web Application Developer</a><div class="location">Burnaby</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/95581837?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Software Applications Engineer (.NET/C#)</a><div class="location">Burnaby</div></li></ul><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/fortinet/careers?trk=job_view_company_see_more_jobs" class="see-more">View more jobs at Fortinet</a></div></div></div><div class="

Please apply using follwing URL Only http://www.jolera.com/job/rmm-tools-ma nager-managed-services/</div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Jolera Inc.</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Jolera started in 2001 as an IT industry generalist. Its focus was the provision of an extensive product and service line card from which end users could choose the necessary SKU’s of managed services, hardware, software and engineering services to satisfy their needs. Jolera combined these products with an award winning personalized, professional customer service; a winning formula which led to significant year over year growth. <br><br>Some years back, however, we realized that our business model needed fine-tuning. Our rapid growth put undue pressure on our sales teams. We were hard pressed to keep our promises, and most critically our clients told us we were behaving like “all the other MSP’s.” And so with the objective of retaining the best of “smaller Jolera”, we transitioned from a direct to the end-user seller of services and products to a channel based seller. Jolera would now be able to focus on what it did best, network architecture and IT solution service and delivery, and allow our channel partners to do what they did best, sales, finance, and CRM.<br><br>We invested millions in R&D, re-tooled, re-engineered and re-oriented ourselves on this “new” strategic path. Our products were redesigned to stand alone as separate white labeled SKU’s. We could offer our reseller partners unique business packages which they, in turn, could market as they saw fit. We could still be the Jolera of old, but we could now focus on a more “contained” client base.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/521252?csrfToken=ajax%3A6553535846341929145" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description"><p>Ontario Pension Board (OPB) is the administrator of the Public Service Pension Plan ("PSPP" or "the Plan") - a major defined benefit pension plan sponsored by the Government of Ontario. Their membership base is made up of certain employees of the provincial government and its agencies, boards and commissions. <p></p></p><p>With $22 billion in assets, 42,102 members, 35,855 retired members and 5,574 former members, the PSPP is one of Canada’s largest pension plans. It is also one of the country’s oldest pension plans, successfully delivering the pension promise since the early 1920s. <p></p></p><p>The PSPP is a defined benefit pension plan designed to enhance the financial security of its members. Retired members receive a pension benefit based on a pre-set (defined) formula. That formula takes into account each member’s earnings history and years of service with the Plan. To fund the pension promise, both members and employers contribute to the Plan. </p><p>  <p></p></p><p>Those interested in exploring this unique opportunity, please contact:   </p><p>Alexander Finn, Research Consultant – Recruitment Solutions </p><p>(416) 640-4293 </p><p>alexander.finn@lhhknightsbridge.com</p></div><div class="media"></div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  Senior Software Development Engineer   $%^& Company Name:  Amazon   $%^&   Job Location:  Vancouver, BC   $%^&   Job Description:  Amazon.com stores and sells millions of unique items worldwide through its Fulfillment Centers (FCs). These items are shipped from tens of thousands of vendors into the many FCs in the Amazon network. We need different quantities of each of these items, we need to pick them up from the vendors at different times, and bring it into the FCs at specific times depending on the priority of the items. Each item has different dimensions, volume and weight and hence is associated with different shipping costs. What we end up with is a gigantic graph, with the nodes being vendors, carrier hubs, Amazon.com FCs and end customers. The arcs in this graph represent the time of transportation and cost of transportation. Each node has a specific capacity, and so does each arc, and there are time constraints on when a product needs to ship out of a node and when it needs to come into a different node. And we need to do all of this while incurring the least cost.<br><br><br><br>What this results in is an extremely challenging optimization problem, that could be solved using OR techniques, or graph theoretic approaches or any other methodology. A small enhancement in the algorithms of scheduling and optimization can result in millions of savings in transportation cost, or in reducing the amount of inventory that Amazon.com holds.<br><br><br><br>As a Software Development Engineer (SDE) working on the team, you will not only be responsible for creative input into these algorithms, and developing them in an Object Oriented and scalable way, but, you will also spearhead the development of these modules in such a way that they can be packaged and sold to third-party customers as well. Hundreds of third party websites and merchants will utilize your software for plan their freight movement. You will be dealing with high transaction websites and web services supporting thousands of transactions per second.<br><br><br><br>We are not tied to one technology - instead, we use what is best suited for the purpose. All of our systems tend to be loosely coupled, communicating using synchronous and asynchronous messaging, leading to a classic distributed processing architecture. We are looking for talented SDEs who enjoy working on creative algorithms, building large scale systems and who thrive in a fast paced fun environment. Knowing JAVA, C++ and Object Oriented Design is a must, and Perl and SQL are highly desired. Experience working with Linux is a big plus.<br><p>&nbsp;</p><br><br><ul><br>	<li>Candidates must have a strong Computer Science background. A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science is a must.</li><br>	<li>Candidates will have 7 or more years of relevant development experience.</li><br>	<li>Proficiency in JAVA, C++ and OOD is a must. Perl, SQL and experience with Linux are desired.</li><br></ul><br><br><p>&nbsp;</p><br><br><p>&nbsp;</p><br><br><ul><br>	<li>Candidates will have experience designing and implementing large-scale distributed systems in a production environment.</li><br>	<li>Candidates will show excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills, with an enthusiastic attitude to support and resolve customer problems.</li><br>	<li>Master&rsquo;s degree or relevant work experience is preferred.</li><br></ul><br><br><br>Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer - F/M/V/D<br><p>&nbsp;</p></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 Equifax organizes and assimilates data on more than 600 million consumers and 81 million businesses worldwide. The company's significant investments in differentiated data, its expertise in advanced analytics to explore and develop new multi-source data solutions, and its leading-edge proprietary technology enable it to create and deliver unparalleled customized insights that enrich both the performance of businesses and the lives of consumers.Headquartered in Atlanta, Equifax operates or has investments in 19 countries and is a member of Standard & Poor's (S&P) 500® Index. Its common stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the symbol EFX. In 2013, Equifax was named a Bloomberg BusinessWeek Top 50 company, was #3 in Fortune's Most Admired list in its category, and was named to InfoWeek 500 as well as the FinTech 100. For more information, please visit www.equifax.com.Equifax is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  Project Manager / Business Analyst, Technology - The Rec Room   $%^& Company Name:  Cineplex Entertainment   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, CA   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong><u>Listing Info<br><br></u></strong>Position Description<br>Do you have a passion for new and exciting nationwide business ventures? Would you love to be part of a team that’s set to expand from coast to coast in Canada? Do you want to play a crucial role in changing the landscape of entertainment in Canada? Now that I have your attention and have peaked your interest – let’s tell you a bit about this revolutionary new concept called The Rec Room.<br><br> <br><br>The concept will feature a wide range of entertainment options: a large attractions area featuring state of the art simulation games, redemption gaming for prizes, and a variety of recreational games that may include luxury bowling, billiards, shuffleboard and ping pong. There will be an auditorium-style venue offering live entertainment – musical acts, bands and comedians – and also featuring a theatre-sized, high definition screen for catching the game or watching a wide range of other entertainment programming. The Rec Room will also offer an upscale casual dining environment, featuring an open kitchen and a contemporary menu offering everyone’s favourites, as well as an “eatertainment-style” concept in the games area. A large centre bar area with adjacent stage will include impressive digital displays and serve as the gathering spot for watching the big game or other major events. The Rec Room will integrate a cutting-edge interactive technology platform that will enhance all aspects of the entertainment experience.<br><br> <br><br>The company has announced that its first location will open in early 2016 at South Edmonton Common, in Edmonton, Alberta and the second is scheduled to open in December of 2016 in Deerfoot City in Calgary, Alberta. Additional locations will open nationally over the course of the next several years.<br><br> <br><br>Cineplex Entertainment, headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, is seeking a strong and experienced hospitality/leisure/entertainment executive to fill the role of <strong>Project Manager / Business Analyst, Technology - The Rec Room</strong>, reporting to the Director, Technology - The Rec Room, to play a key role in the launch and expansion of this concept across Canada into a successful multi-unit business in the coming years.<br><br> <br><br>The Environment and Position Summary The Project Manager / Business Analyst – The Rec Room will work closely with Internal IT teams, vendors, and Rec Room management groups to ensure successful definition, development and delivery of all The Rec Room’s technological endeavours. Cineplex has a dynamic Information Technology team; continuously engaged in advancing the capabilities of the company. Cineplex IT is broken roughly into four groups: Infrastructure, Support, Development, and Project Management. The success of all four of these groups depends on the cohesion of all. In this role, you are a Project Manager and Business Analyst working closely with business groups, ensuring that solutions align with Cineplex operations. You forge relationships with internal stakeholders, project sponsors, and third party software vendors. You are committed to the success of your portfolio.  <br><br><br><br> <br><br><strong>Values & Personality<br><br></strong>The position calls for: <br><ul><li>A technologist – a self-learner who loves and can pick up new technologies.</li><li>Someone who is Guest experience focused - committed to delivering client satisfaction.</li><li>Someone with an eye for detail – with the user experience in mind.</li><li>A communicator, one who takes pride in ensuring that the message is always received and understood.</li><li>A scientifically minded individual, keen to isolate the facts.</li><li>A strategist, an organizer – always comes prepared.</li><li>Someone tenacious and committed, with a “CAN DO” attitude!</li><li>Someone who can calmly prioritize and work on multiple initiatives at once. </li><li>Someone charismatic and respectful of others, able to forge strong relationships.</li><li>Someone who can consistently produce quality results within limited timelines.<br><br><br></li></ul> <br><br><strong><u>The Primary Role Of This Position Is The Management Of And Execution Of IT Projects For The Rec Room.  You Wear Many Hats. In Addition To Project Management, You Are a Business Analyst, Product Manager, Data Analyst, Functional Specialist And Third Tier Support.   Your Success Is Measured In Achieving The Following Objectives<br><br><br><br></u></strong> <br><br><strong><u>Business Analysis <br><br></u></strong><strong><u>Ensure The Success Of Your Projects By<br><br></u></strong><li>Author, own and keep up to date a plan of tasks, timing and people that will ensure success.  Ensure key people validate the plan when it undergoes change.  Ensure that the remaining effort is clear and up to date. stakeholders informed and engaged throughout a project - addressing their concerns and managing their expectation appropriately.  A weekly update email should be part of the regular cycle of communication beyond individual meetings.</li><li>Keep executive stakeholders informed and committed to championing the work.</li><li>Communicate in an effective manner. While E-mail is a useful tool, it is not always the best method of communication. Choose the best method of communication, whether it is e-mail, a quick call followed up by an e-mail, or a meeting. <br><br><br></li> <br><br><strong><u>Roadmap, Client and Portfolio Management<br><br></u></strong><strong><u>Ensure The Overall Success Of Your Portfolio By<br><br></u></strong><li>Prompt radar.</li><li>Keeping your roadmap up to date with latest asks of the business, re-prioritizing appropriately in line with the strategic objectives of the business and management.</li><li>Regular stakeholder and senior stakeholder communications/meetings/touch points to review the roadmap and ensure we are aligned. Ensure we are changing as the business changes.</li><li>Address the demand of the business by doing what can be done to move new requests along the process as best as possible while other projects may be the current focus of the team.</li><li>Keeping quick wins and smaller initiatives moving - always delivering some progress - while larger projects may be taking their time to complete.</li><li>Explain technical details in a manner that non-technical clients and stakeholders can understand. <br><br><br></li> <br><br><strong><u>Functional Role & Solution Delivery<br><br></u></strong><strong><u>For Your Client Primary Applications Of Which You Should Be a Functional Specialist On<br><br></u></strong><li>Be a corporate functional expert, understanding how the different roles within the business operate the application.</li><li>Ensure that documenting is authored and curated for all standard operating practices particular to Cineplex (working with business owners). </li><li>Where appropriate understand how the application configuration is maintained and managed.</li><li>Develop the skills and knowhow to build out of the box solutions with these technologies, to deliver quick wins to the business & overcome challenges.</li><li>Keep up to date with the latest and greatest regarding this technology, by following blogs, forums and user groups and other relevant information sources.<br><br><br></li> <br><br><strong><u>Quality Assurance Management<br><br></u></strong><strong><u>Ensure Successful Testing By<br><br></u></strong><li>Authoring and curating a library of functional test scripts for the applications and business processes within your portfolio - ensuring that the scope of the business and functionality of the application is accurately covered.</li><li>Ensure that necessary changes to test scripts as result of failures in test cycles are factored back into said test scripts in a timely manner (so as to not lose sight of them)</li><li>With each application feature release, author/update test scripts that cover these new features.</li><li>Marshalling business stakeholder test signatories through the user acceptance testing cycles, acquiring appropriate sign-off artifacts at the end of this cycle.</li><li>Work with the new QA Automation Specialist to migrate our current paper based test processes to automated solutions - learning these new test tools and then training users appropriately.  <br><br><br></li> <br><br><strong><u>Housekeeping & Managing Up<br><br></u></strong><li>Adopt and leverage the IT tools, standards, protocol, processes, and cadence of Software Solutions team used to deliver on the success factors noted above. </li><li>Escalate appropriately and timely when a situation threatens the success factors noted above.<br><br><br></li> <br><br><strong><u>Support Management Support Is Job One And It Is a Mandate That We Share With Other Support Personnel.  Its Success Will Be Ensured By<br><br></u></strong><li>Prompt response to support threads.</li><li>Triaging effectively to determine business impact and sense of urgency around a support case - providing prompt attention to incidents with the highest impact to the business</li><li>Effective problem investigation that leads to problem isolation.  This involves the acquisition of all evidence available (logs, accurate UX accounts, app data etc), leveraging technology specialists, lining up the timing of events to present probable narratives, narrowing possibilities based on the evidence and not wasting time on hypothesis with clear evidence to the contrary.</li><li>Effective management of support tickets with 3rd party Software Vendors, which involves: accurately documenting the issue within the support management tool of the vendor, including all necessary evidence to help 3rd party team isolate situation, documenting repeatable steps that produce the issue, prompt response to vendor support team queries, facilitation of calls or screen casts to assist in isolating/understanding issue, connect business users when necessary, prompting vendor team appropriately for incident updates to ensure momentum on investigation/solution.</li><li>Reducing your support load by appropriate hand off to business owners and support personnel (CMC, Guest Services etc).  Hand off includes: Knowledge Base authoring and curating, communicating and coordinating effectively with support personnel management to ensure the appropriate training. </li><li>Periodically reviewing all knowledge base materials within your portfolio to ensure that it is up to date and reflective of any recent changes in the environment.</li><li>Periodically touching base with support teams, reviewing KB materials and ensuring that support team are fully armed.</li><li>Escalating to support personnel management when support teams have failed to handle a support case appropriately or have handed off too soon to second tier support without leveraging KB materials/training.  Reviewing and adjusting process if necessary as a result of consultation with support personnel management.   </li><li>Always analyzing support incidents types, to isolate improvements to knowledge base, business processes, training or application features (likely all) - and then making these changes a priority to be addressed - drumming up the necessary support from other stakeholders and driving the changes needed to reduce support and empower users.  </li><li>Adopt and leverage the IT tools, standards, protocol, processes, and cadence of the Software Solutions team used to deliver on the success factors noted above.</li><li>Escalating appropriately when a situation threatens the success factors noted above.<br><br><br></li> <br><br><strong><u>Desired Skills And Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>3-5 years of experience in a relevant role</li><li>Well organized task driven, deliverable driven The Manager will oversee the day-to-day support of Call Routing Systems for multiple Call Centres. This position calls for a flexible, business-minded individual who is focused on results.  To this end, this candidate must be capable and comfortable with challenging the status quo, all while working effectively in a collaborative environment with all business units and levels. Maintain a complete view of initiatives expected to impact contact metrics such as volumes and average handle time. Formulate senior management presentations, communicating new trends through detailed reporting and analysis; discussing service delivery opportunities on a continuous basis. Provide regular communication to the Call Centres to ensure all employees are apprised of policy and process changes/enhancements. Provide direction, leadership & on-coaching to WFM Analyst. nearly 50 years. Following the acquisition of BC Biomedical on April 2, 2013 and CML Healthcare on October 1st, 2013, LifeLabs nearly doubled in size, now providing more than 100 million diagnostic tests for approximately 19 million patients visits annually. Information from these tests plays a vital role in predicting, diagnosing, treating and monitoring disease. LifeLabs operates the largest community medical laboratory network in Canada, together with our hospital and healthcare partners. class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">FLIR Systems, Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, markets, and distributes technologies that enhance perception and awareness. We bring innovative sensing solutions into daily life through our thermal imaging systems, visible-light imaging systems, locator systems, measurement and diagnostic systems, and advanced threat detection systems. Our products improve the way people interact with the world around them, enhance public safety and well-being, increase energy efficiency, and enable healthy and entertained communities.<br><br>Pioneers in thermal imaging, we were founded in 1978, originally providing infrared imaging systems that were installed on vehicles for use in conducting energy audits. More than 1,100 customers rely on Coverity to help them deliver high-integrity software. We’ve contributed to some of the most complex software projects in history, including the Mars Rover and the large Hadron Collider project, and are looking for great and passionate people to join our team.<br><br>Our team works on cutting-edge problems in compilers, build systems, program analysis, code coverage, modern web-applications, IDE plugins, and much more. The challenges range from performance (we need to analyze 10s of millions of lines code in a few hours), capacity (we need to serve organizations with 10s of thousands of developers maintaining 100s of millions of lines of code), to smooth deployments and upgrades. Our people share a passion to "help developers build better code". They are smart, work hard to take advantage of the great opportunity in front of us, strive for excellence, and have fun as a team.</div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Synopsys</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Synopsys, Inc. IBMers are working with customers around the world to apply the company&apos;s business consulting, technology and Research & Development expertise to enable systems of engagement that deliver dynamic insights for businesses and governments worldwide.<br> <br>The following student position is a part of IBM Canada&apos;s EPIC (Employment Pathways to Interns & Co-ops) Student Program. The engineer will work closely with software developers/engineers, requirement developers/engineers and program managers through the entire product lifecycle. The QA engineer reviews requirement specifications and design documents, to better understand the features and specifications for the efficient design of test cases to address the full spectrum of the requirements and quality. The automation test Engineer should improve engineering productivity. specific products and solutions automatically.<br><br><strong> Key Responsibilities<br></strong><ul> <li>Participate in requirement reviews in order to write test procedures and test cases</li> Job Title:  Billing & Accounts Receivable Coordinator   $%^& Company Name:  Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP   $%^&   Job Location:  Canada   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>Reporting to the Manager, Client Billing Services, the Billing & Accounts Receivable Coordinator is responsible for assisting in all phases of client billing and collection, including bill preparation, submission, follow-up and communication with clients and Partners and subsequent payment and outstanding bill collection. This is a detail oriented position with an emphasis on tenacity, time management, technical tasks and interpersonal skills. </p><p>  </p><p><strong>Major Responsibiliti</strong><strong>es and Duties:</strong> </p><ul><li><p>Process pre-bills received via Pre-Bill Viewer and handle monthly billings for approximately 25 to 30 Billing Partners. </p></li><li><p>Draft and finalize client invoices for distribution to clients. </p></li><li><p>Oversee and coordinate month end billing and collections.  Deal with escalation of billing & collection disputes and act as first point of contact before escalation.  </p></li><li><p>Submit and coordinate third party billing (e-bills). Administer new and existing e-billing clients, upload LEDES/pdf invoices on e-billing sites. </p></li><li><p>Follow up with Manager, Client Billing Services, Partners and clients as appropriate regarding overdue accounts and WIP using various reports and systems. </p></li><li><p>Maintain good relations with internal and external clients.  </p></li><li><p>Initiate contact with client regarding outstanding receivables. Handle client inquiries and resolve discrepancies and maintain accurate records of all communications in the system. </p></li><li><p>Resolve any unresolved or partial payments received from clients. </p></li><li><p>Maintain accurate and timely client and matter information with regards to billing and receivables in computerized billing system.  </p></li><li><p>Assist with special projects as well as staff training. </p></li><li><p>Participate in the implementation and testing of systems upgrades and billing/collection software. </p></li></ul><p>Active involvement in process improvements including developing innovative, proactive and efficient ways to improve quality, process and customer service. </p><p><strong> </strong> </p><p><strong>Position Requirements:</strong> </p><p><em>Education and Experience</em> </p><ul><li>College diploma including some accounting and finance courses. </li><li>Minimum of three years billing and/or collections experience preferably at a professional services firm or a law firm.  </li><li>Experience in a team-oriented environment that encompasses all aspects of the day-to-day billing and collections operations. </li><li>An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be acceptable.<p> </p></li></ul><p><em>Knowledge and Skills</em> </p><ul><li><p>Proficiency with computers including advanced Microsoft Excel skills. </p></li><li><p>Experience with Aderant software would be an asset.  </p></li><li><p>Excellent communication skills (both oral and written), focussed listening, interpersonal and negotiation skills. </p></li><li><p>Sound judgement and strong analytical skills. </p></li><li>Attention to detail, organization and time management skills along with the ability to balance daily work. </li><li>Positive attitude, patience, resilience and a sense of humour. </li><li>A compliance and procedural mindset is required. </li></ul><p>We thank all applicants for their interest in Osler; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. Osler is an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. </p><p>  </p><p>Please note that any offer of employment will be conditional upon background and reference checks, including a criminal record check, credit check, and employment and educational verifications. </p><p>  </p><p>If you have the required background with the ability to provide exceptional customer service and wish to work in one of Canada’s leading law firms, please reply in confidence with a cover letter and résumé by the closing date to: </p><p>  </p><p>Human Resources <br> Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP <br> P.O. Box 50, 1 First Canadian Place<br> Toronto, ON  M5X 1B8<br> Fax: 416-862-6666 <br> e-mail: hrtoronto@osler.com </p><p><strong> </strong> </p><p><strong>Closing Date: January 18, 2016</strong> </p><p><strong> </strong> </p><p><strong>No agencies or phone calls please.</strong> </p><p> </p></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/12804?csrfToken=ajax%3A6605012288355380172" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/12804?csrfToken=ajax%3A6605012288355380172" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description"><p>Osler is a leading business law firm uniquely positioned to advise Canadian, U.S. and international<br> clients on an array of domestic and cross-border legal issues. Since 1984, Cisco has led in the innovation of several networking technologies such as routing, switching, security, unified communications, video, and wireless. Cisco continues to lead in new areas such as Cloud, Data Center, Virtualization, SDN, Internet of Things, etc… Our responsible business practices help ensure business sustainability and environmentally conscious operations and products.<br>Cisco is a $48 Billion dollar global leader in supplying leading edge, best-in-class networking products driving today's Internet. The company is ranked as one of the world's best employers and spends over $5 Billion dollars a year invested in R&D. Cisco is a great place to grow your career.<br><br>The Team<br><br>The R&D campus in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada is looking for experienced SW developers. You will be an active member of the Cloud & Network Solutions software development team and contribute to the implementation, testing and customer delivery of state-of-the-art Cloud Network Automation & Provisioning of Cisco Datacenter Network Infrastructure applications for the leading Private Cloud Management Platforms.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>• Bachelor or Master Degree in CS/EE, or equivalent experience is required. Any other demonstrated high technology aptitude is desired<br>• Software development or software testing experience<br>• Software development life cycle<br>• Proficient with any of the following programming languages: C/C#/OOP, or scripting languages TCL/Python.<br>• Proficient with Test Driven Development, Static analysis and Code Coverage<br>• Source repositories such as Git< GitLab or Git Hub<br>• IDE Tools like Visual Studio, Eclipse etc<br>• Excellent communication skills<br><br>Desirable Skills<br>• Experience with Agile/Scrum process is highly desirable<br>• Knowledge of network protocols and/or routing protocols is highly desirable<br>• Experience with Multi-threading and Network Programming<br>• Knowledge of CloudManagement Platforms, Windows Azure Pack, Open Stack, VMWare vCloud Director or vCenter<br>• Knowledge of Server Virtualization Plaforms: Microsoft Hyper-V, VMWare ESXi, RHEL KVM<br>• Direct experience with Linux and related infrastructure software<br><br>About Cisco<br>The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great place to Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.<br><br>Lieu de travail : Ottawa (Kanata), Ontario, Canada<br><br>L’entité commerciale<br><br>Cisco est le chef de file mondial des réseaux qui transforment les façons dont les gens se connectent, communiquent et collaborent. Depuis 1984, Cisco est le chef de file de l’innovation en matière de technologies de réseaux basées sur les protocoles IP, comme le routage, la commutation, la sécurité, les communications unifiées, la vidéo et les communications sans fil. Cisco continue d’être le chef de file dans de nouveaux domaines comme l’infonuagique, les centres de données, la virtualisation, les réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN), l’Internet des objets, etc. Nos pratiques d’affaires socialement responsables permettent d’assurer la pérennité des activités et des produits, et ce, dans le respect de l’environnement.<br>Cisco est un chef de file mondial de 48 milliards de dollars qui offre les produits de réseau à la fine pointe qui alimentent l’Internet d’aujourd’hui. La société est l’un des meilleurs employeurs au monde; elle investit plus de 5 milliards de dollars par an en recherche et développement. Cisco offre un lieu de choix où développer sa carrière.<br><br>L’équipe<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Le centre canadien de R et D situé à Ottawa en Ontario est à la recherche de développeurs de logiciels expérimentés. Le candidat retenu sera un membre actif de l’équipe de développement de logiciels et contribuera à la mise en œuvre, aux tests et à la livraison d’applications et de services d’avant-garde des plans de contrôle et de données notamment des protocoles tels que les protocoles de routage IPv4 et IPv6, MPLS, L2VPN/VPLS et de réseaux de diffusion de contenu (CDN) fondés sur des architectures de réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN) et de réseaux virtualisés. Nous sommes des pionniers et nous l’avons été dès les débuts de la connectivité. Aujourd’hui, nous mettons sur pied des équipes qui étoffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilité, de l’infonuagique, de la sécurité, des technologies de l’information et du traitement des données volumineuses, y compris les logiciels et les services-conseils. À mesure que Cisco fournit les solutions de réseau qui optimisent l’Internet, nous relions entre eux les éléments qui ne l’étaient pas auparavant. Imaginez si vous pouviez créer des idées qui changent le monde! Vos idées porteuses auront une incidence sur des domaines aussi variés que le commerce de détail, les secteurs de la santé et du divertissement, en passant par les secteurs publics et privés et bien d’autres. Collaborez avec des gens tournés vers l’innovation dans un environnement stimulant et une culture d’entreprise souple qui ont permis à Cisco d’être reconnue pour son milieu de travail exceptionnel. Environ 10 milliards d’objets sont actuellement connectés à l’échelle mondiale et il est prévu que plus de 50 milliards d’objets le seront dans le futur. C’est pourquoi au sein de Cisco, vous disposerez d’un nombre exponentiel de possibilités d’avancement.<br><li>LI-EMEA-DO1<br></li><strong>Type de poste: </strong>Expérimenté<br><strong>Catégories des offres d'emploi: </strong>Aucun<br><br></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Cisco</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO) enables people to make powerful connections--whether in business, education, philanthropy, or creativity. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
Job Title:  Systems Engineer - Commercial   $%^& Company Name:  VMware   $%^&   Job Location:  TORONTO, ON, M5R 1A6, CAN   $%^&   Job Description:  The Commercial Field SE will provide support to the VMware Commercial Sales Team and Channel in pursuit of virtualization, cloud management, end user computing, and other opportunities to help our customers move to the Software Defined Data-Center. They are expected to help accelerate and close business within a geographic territory or defined set of accounts. Typical duties include creating customized onsite presentations and demonstrations; assisting customers and partners with product evaluations and product feature/benefit discussions; assisting with solution designs and/or proposal development and responses; and enabling VMware Partners. The SE will be expected to start with a minimum of strong knowledge of VMware vSphere and one other VMware product (Such as vRealize Operations, VMware Horizon View, Site Recovery Manager, vCloud Air, NSX) and will continue to build strengths by learning from Systems Engineers and other Technical Services personnel. customers<br><br>• Deliver onsite and remote product and solution presentations and demonstrations<br><br>• Assist with the training of sales and VMware Partner personnel<br><br>• Must learn and maintain current knowledge of complete VMware product set and be able to describe key features and benefits of each<br><br>• Develop and deliver responses to customer and prospect technical inquiries, including RFPs, RFIs, and initial architecture discussions<br><br>• Provide evaluations and proof-of-concept assistance to partners and customers<br><br>• Participate in SE discussion forums<br><br>• Document customer feature requests and issues<br><br>• Assist product development in testing new products<br><br>• Keeps abreast of developments within industry and the organization<br><br>• Establish positive working relationships – internal and external<br><br>Key Interfaces:<br><br>• Regional Account Executives (RAEs)<br><br>• VMware Channel Partners<br><br>• Regional Sales Management<br><br>•
