Job Title:  Researcher   $%^& Company Name:  AXDEV Group Inc.   $%^&   Job Location:  Montreal, Canada Area   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>AXDEV Group Inc. is a service, consulting and research company specializing in the health industry. AXDEV Group Inc.’s head office is located in Brossard, Québec and specializes in improving performance of professionals, teams and organizations. </p><p>  </p><p>We are currently looking for an outgoing, proactive and fully bilingual Researcher or Research Assistant to join a dynamic team of passionate professionals. The candidate must have 3 to 5 years experiences in human behaviour research or organizational development research. The ideal Researcher has experience in coordinating multiple projects and the capability to plan and execute research plan. The Researcher reports to the General Manager. <p></p></p><p> </p><p> </p><p><strong>Main Responsibilities </strong></p><p> </p><p><strong>Research: </strong></p><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Work and support the Research team in research design, data collection, assessing research statistical tools, analysis, interpretation and presentation of results; </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Manages research projects when responsible as a project head; </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Supports research data collection by facilitating focus groups, interviews and observational studies. </li></ul></ul><p> </p><p><strong> </strong> </p><p> </p><p><strong>Design of research</strong>: </p><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Is responsible for designing and conducting performance assessments and evaluations as well as developing innovative and impactful solutions for client’s projects;  </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Manages recruitment and enrolment in studies, creates documents and manages research subjects identification, </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Develops, manages and maintains research data coordination, data entry and management, quality assurance activities for research outputs, including preparation of reports, manuscripts, presentations, surveys and interviews and conducts background literature reviews as necessary, </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Designs data collection instruments, and implements analysis plan using appropriate descriptive, inferential, and statistical and research methodology and programs (e.g. SPSS, N-Vivo); </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Develops and writes research reports, presentations and manuscripts. </li></ul></ul><p> </p><p>  </p><p> </p><p><strong>Development of research and evaluation of studies:</strong> </p><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Develops research outcomes and objectives to anchor performance assessment, and ensures continued alignment with these outcomes and objectives throughout a given project. </li></ul></ul><p> </p><ul><ul><li>Develops interpretations and recommendations in collaboration with research team and based on proposal outcomes. </li></ul></ul><p> </p><p>  </p><p> </p><p><strong>Responsible for Communication and Liaison</strong> with Research Manager and clients </p><p> </p><p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE</strong> </p><p> </p><ul><li><p>Bachelor, or Master level or undergraduate level Psychology, Sociology, Organisational/Behavioural or Health Sciences or any related field involving Research Methodology and Statistics, </p></li><li><p>At least 2 to 4 years experience in research preparation, quantitative and qualitative Research Management and Analysis, with at least 1 year in Health Care industry and/or Industrial or Organizational Psychology; </p></li><li><p>Knowledge of SPSS,  NVivo or similar software, endnotes and data collection is an asset </p></li><li><p>Good knowledge of common office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.) and MS-Project.  An asset: FileMaker Pro and MS Access </p></li><li><p>Ability to work independently and as a team player to gather, analyze, organize data </p></li><li><p>Perfectly bilingual (strong knowledge of French and English, both written and verbal). </p></li><li><p>Excellent communication skills and positive client / research subject interaction capabilities </p></li><li><p>Capability to manage multiple activities- Capability to plan and execute a research plan </p></li><li><p>Strong focus on quality and attention to details in ensuring quality assurance We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great place to Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.<br><br>Lieu de travail : Ottawa (Kanata), Ontario, Canada<br><br>L’entité commerciale<br><br>Cisco est le chef de file mondial des réseaux qui transforment les façons dont les gens se connectent, communiquent et collaborent. Depuis 1984, Cisco est le chef de file de l’innovation en matière de technologies de réseaux basées sur les protocoles IP, comme le routage, la commutation, la sécurité, les communications unifiées, la vidéo et les communications sans fil. Cisco continue d’être le chef de file dans de nouveaux domaines comme l’infonuagique, les centres de données, la virtualisation, les réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN), l’Internet des objets, etc. Nos pratiques d’affaires socialement responsables permettent d’assurer la pérennité des activités et des produits, et ce, dans le respect de l’environnement.<br>Cisco est un chef de file mondial de 48 milliards de dollars qui offre les produits de réseau à la fine pointe qui alimentent l’Internet d’aujourd’hui. La société est l’un des meilleurs employeurs au monde; elle investit plus de 5 milliards de dollars par an en recherche et développement. Cisco offre un lieu de choix où développer sa carrière.<br><br>L’équipe<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Le centre canadien de R et D situé à Ottawa en Ontario est à la recherche de développeurs de logiciels expérimentés. Le candidat retenu sera un membre actif de l’équipe de développement de logiciels et contribuera à la mise en œuvre, aux tests et à la livraison d’applications et de services d’avant-garde des plans de contrôle et de données notamment des protocoles tels que les protocoles de routage IPv4 et IPv6, MPLS, L2VPN/VPLS et de réseaux de diffusion de contenu (CDN) fondés sur des architectures de réseaux définis par logiciel (SDN) et de réseaux virtualisés. Nous sommes des pionniers et nous l’avons été dès les débuts de la connectivité. Aujourd’hui, nous mettons sur pied des équipes qui étoffent nos solutions technologiques dans les domaines de la mobilité, de l’infonuagique, de la sécurité, des technologies de l’information et du traitement des données volumineuses, y compris les logiciels et les services-conseils. À mesure que Cisco fournit les solutions de réseau qui optimisent l’Internet, nous relions entre eux les éléments qui ne l’étaient pas auparavant. Imaginez si vous pouviez créer des idées qui changent le monde! Vos idées porteuses auront une incidence sur des domaines aussi variés que le commerce de détail, les secteurs de la santé et du divertissement, en passant par les secteurs publics et privés et bien d’autres. Collaborez avec des gens tournés vers l’innovation dans un environnement stimulant et une culture d’entreprise souple qui ont permis à Cisco d’être reconnue pour son milieu de travail exceptionnel. Environ 10 milliards d’objets sont actuellement connectés à l’échelle mondiale et il est prévu que plus de 50 milliards d’objets le seront dans le futur. C’est pourquoi au sein de Cisco, vous disposerez d’un nombre exponentiel de possibilités d’avancement.<br><li>LI-EMEA-DO1<br></li><strong>Job Type:<br></strong>Experienced<br><strong>Opportunity Category: </strong>*None<br><br></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Cisco</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO) enables people to make powerful connections--whether in business, education, philanthropy, or creativity. Cisco hardware, software, and service offerings are used to create the Internet solutions that make networks possible--providing easy access to information anywhere, at any time. <br><br>Cisco was founded in 1984 by a small group of computer scientists from Stanford University. Since the company's inception, Cisco engineers have been leaders in the development of Internet Protocol (IP)-based networking technologies. Today, with more than 65,225 employees worldwide, this tradition of innovation continues with industry-leading products and solutions in the company's core development areas of routing and switching, as well as in advanced technologies such as home networking, IP telephony, optical networking, security, storage area networking, and wireless technology. In addition to its products, Cisco provides a broad range of service offerings, including technical support and advanced services. <br><br>Cisco sells its products and services, both directly through its own sales force as well as through its channel partners, to large enterprises, commercial businesses, service providers, and consumers.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="

Job Title:  Territory Account Manager, Retail Solutions   $%^& Company Name:  NCR   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto   $%^&   Job Description:  <p>TITLE<strong>:  Territory Account Manager, Retail Solutions </strong></p> <p>LOCATION<strong>:  Toronto </strong></p> <p>GRADE:<strong> 11</strong></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p>We are NCR, a global tech company—and we run the everyday transactions that <strong>make your life easier</strong>. We’re the world leader in consumer transaction technologies, turning everyday interactions with businesses into exceptional experiences. With our software, hardware and portfolio of services, we make more than 300 million transactions possible every day.<br><br>We’re helping our customers respond to the demand for fast, easy and convenient transactions with intuitive <strong>self-service</strong> and <strong>assisted-service</strong> options. Our solutions help businesses around the world increase revenue, build loyalty, reach new customers and lower their costs of operations. <br><br>By continually learning about—and pioneering—how the world interacts and transacts, we’re helping companies not only reach their goals, but also change the way all of us shop, eat, travel, bank and connect. Together, we are shaping the future. </p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>POSITION SUMMARY & KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY</strong></p> <p> </p> <p>If you are a sales person with the agility to thrive in a fast changing environment, have experience creating highly complex software, hardware, and consulting solutions for large & strategic retailers in Canada, and have a history of success developing a funnel and selling across multiple offices in the C-Suite, we want to talk to you. As an Account Manager in our Retail Solutions Sales Organization, you will be responsible for selling complex enterprise and platform based solutions that provide high value to our customers. You will manage sales through forecasting, account resource allocation, account strategy, and planning. Participate in the development, presentation and sales propositions. Negotiate pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale. Position is a quota-carrying role with responsibility for working with customers and prospects for NCR software, services and hardware.</p> <p> </p> <p>Key Areas of Responsibility include: (Under supervision of senior Account Managers)</p> <p>·         Identify and qualify top prospects for NCR solutions: including software, services and hardware </p> <p>·         Develop customer specific value propositions, business cases, and ROI </p> <p>·         Selling solutions and services to major retailers. </p> <p>·         Create and own executive relationships across marketing, operations, & IT to ensure full breadth of NCR’s portfolio is leveraged to solve customer business issues </p> <p>·         Understand customer’s business objectives. Be able to tie NCR solutions to their problems ensuring NCR is viewed as a strategic partner to help them meet these goals. </p> <p>·         Develop account plans with measurable time bound goals and objectives </p> <p>·         Develop a strategic roadmap which aligns customer needs, issues, opportunities with industry best practices and our company’s offerings </p> <p>·         Manage the sales process identifying opportunities, managing the funnel & forecast, handling contract negotiations, and driving deployment of solutions. </p> <p>·         Manage engagement of NCR resources into customer base </p> <p>·         Ensure ongoing customer satisfaction during presales and post sales engagements. </p> <p>·         Communicate efficiently internally and drive cross functional teams to ensure your customer’s success </p> <p>·         Previous successful client management in the retail segment, especially with top tier clients in the grocery, convenience, fuel, drug store, discount, and specialty verticals.</p> <p> </p> <p> </p></div></div><div class="skills-section"><h3 class="sub-header">Desired Skills and Experience</h3><div class="rich-text"><p><strong>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS</strong></p> <p>·         Requires BS/BA in related discipline and experience in related field. Will consider additional industry experience in lieu of degree.</p> <p>·         10 years + of related business and sales experience along with a proven track record of success selling technology in the retail vertical </p> <p>·         In-depth experience and understanding of the retail market and related competition </p> <p>·         Background in SaaS and/or Application Software </p> <p>·         Demonstrated history of managing the sales process and developing a strategic roadmap which aligns customer needs, issues, opportunities with industry best practices and our company’s offerings. </p> <p>·         Collaborate with customers and partners enabling them to experience greater business value from our company. </p> <p>·         Strong presentation, communication and interpersonal skills, including establishing credibility and trust to lead cross functional teams that can impact your customer including Engineering, development, finance, legal and Professional Services organizations </p> <p>·         Demonstrated ability to understand sales barriers and overcome initial technology hurdles to close business</p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS</strong></p> <p>·        </p></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope We hire fierce competitors. We hire individuals that are fearless trail blazers. He / She will be required to conduct sessions with the customer over the phone or in-person, attend project meetings and provide status on progress of activities and deliverables. Finally, the Consultant and Senior Consultant will provide customers with as needed consulting and general assistance and be a ‘go-to’ resource for specific functional areas. customers.</p></div></div><div class="skills-section"><h3 class="sub-header">Desired Skills and Experience</h3><div class="rich-text"><p>• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Accounting or Management to Corporate guidelines; </li><li>Utilize software tools for proactive support and to correct issues remotely; </li><li>Provide remote support for both POS and theatre back office equipment; </li><li>Participate in Theatre system deployments including POS rollouts / upgrades, backoffice upgrades, printer replacements and Network upgrades; </li><li>Work closely with internal IT resources and third party vendors in resolving Hardware / Software issues at Cineplex Entertainment Theatres; </li><li>Participate in any projects and duties as assigned by IT Management. </li></ul><p>Knowledge service experience demonstrating application functionality. </li><li>Experience with Vista POS Software or general retail POS systems would be an asset. </li></ul><p><strong> </strong> levels while meeting revenue and profit targets.  <p></p></p><p>KEY METRICS: </p><ul><li>Planned Revenue Attainment and Growth </li><li>Services Gross Margin </li><li>Contract Renewal Plan </li><li>Operational Metrics Status Report / Action Plan </li></ul><p>ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: </p><ul><li>Responsible to manage a team of Customer Operations Managers (COMs) who manage the execution of one or more MPS Statements of Work for multiple large accounts and/or multiple complex small accounts </li><li>Ensure direct reports execute and deliver Lexmark responsibilities against signed Statements of Work, which can be highly complex and require a focus on steady state operational elements, profitability and growth.  Ensure all elements of the contract are delivered within the budget while meeting customer satisfaction expectations </li><li>Responsible to ensure effective management of thousands of installed devices with revenues typically >$50M </li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the Customer Satisfaction of the client for the provision of hardware, supplies and services </li><li>Coordinates and holds regular communication with the internal team regarding the status of the account.   Tracks team progress and conducts status meetings both internally and externally </li><li>As required, responsible for implementation of Lexmark services against a defined project schedule and budget and monitor the implementation process and manage scope changes as they occur </li><li>Ensure strict adherence to Governance model within each account; responsibilities required to support contracted service delivery to the Customer </li><li>May lead or manage a CFT that includes various organizations within Lexmark; such as but not limited to Supply We also use tools and technologies like Ember.js, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch, Puppet, and Jenkins CI. centre associates in delivering a consistent Client Experience. </p><p>  </p><p><strong><u>Strategic Accountabilities:</u></strong> </p><ul><li>Collaborates with stakeholders to understand the Job Title:  Senior Business Intelligence Analyst   $%^& Company Name:  Amazon   $%^&   Job Location:  Toronto, CA   $%^&   Job Description:  <strong><u>Listing Info<br><br></u></strong>Job Description<br>Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrives you wonder how it got to you so fast? Wondered where it came from and how much it would have cost Amazon? If so, the Amazon Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) team is for you. We build systems to peer into the future and estimate the distribution of tens of millions of products every week to Amazon’s warehouses in the most cost-effective way. This team is focused on saving hundreds of millions of dollars using cutting edge science, machine learning, and scalable distributed software on the Cloud that automates and optimizes inventory and shipments to customers under the uncertainty of demand, pricing and supply.<br><br>Amazon seeks a passionate, results-oriented, Senior BIA to identify strategic initiatives that will form our next generation Global Supply Chain systems. We strive to solve complex supply chain optimization problems that no one else has solved yet. Do you think you are up to the challenge? Would you like to learn more and stretch your skills and career?<br><br>Successful candidates will have strong analysis skills who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. This is a highly visible role that requires partnering with Worldwide Retail, Finance, and Operations teams to impact Amazon’s bottom line. You must have the experience and capability to create and present documentation for senior executives and align your roadmap with Amazon’s strategic objectives. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential. You should be experienced in working with data to analyze root causes, implementing long term solutions, and leading teams with advanced analytical, mathematical, and quantitative capabilities.<br><br><strong><u>Your Responsibilities Include<br><br></u></strong>· Identify the biggest opportunities in Amazon's Supply Chain<br>· Analyze the potential customer and financial impacts<br>· Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain teams, retail organizations, and software teams to identify new features and projects<br>· Identify ways to automate analysis through smarter software systems<br>· Prioritize the features and projects based on their relevance<br>· Track the realized savings and impacts, and communicate results with senior leaders<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>· B.S. degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar quantitative field<br>· 3+ years work experience in relevant field<br>· Experience in using SQL to analyze data in a database or data warehouse and be able to use a major programming (e.g. Java/C) and/or a scripting language (Perl, Unix shell) to process data for modeling<br>· Experience working with a wide range of predictive and decision models and data mining techniques, as well as tools for developing such models<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>· Candidates with a Master’s degree or higher with additional experience are preferred. Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer<br><br></div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Amazon</span><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover virtually anything they want to buy online. By giving customers more of what they want - low prices, vast selection, and convenience - Amazon continues to grow and evolve as a world-class e-commerce platform.<br><br>Founded by Jeff Bezos, the Amazon.com website started in 1995 as a place to buy books because of the unique customer experience the Web could offer book lovers. Bezos believed that only the Internet could offer customers the convenience of browsing a selection of millions of book titles in a single sitting. During the first 30 days of business, Amazon fulfilled orders for customers in 50 states and 45 countries - all shipped from his Seattle-area garage.<br><br>Amazon's evolution from Web site to e-commerce partner to development platform is driven by the spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA. We are looking for a senior product manager to join our team, you will be responsible for a specific product line. The position has responsibility for the growth and business success of the assigned product line and product category. The role is responsible for developing strategies and managing tactical execution of product business objectives and development plans. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality.</p><br><p> As a member of our team you will contribute to the continued success of our mobile computing product portfolio. You will define products and drive innovation and future product strategies from existing ideas, and help to develop new ideas based on your industry experience and your contact with customers, partners and industry experts. The successful execution of these product strategies will enable Zebra to bring to market highly differentiated and innovation solutions that enable our customers to improve productively, accuracy and operationally efficiency within their business operations. </p><br><p><strong> </strong></p><br><p>The Senior Product Manager is responsible for comprehensive life cycle management of assigned products to optimize the market performance of these products in accordance with Zebra's strategic and financial objectives. Ultimately, the Senior Product Manager reconciles and processes internal and external inputs; establishes product direction, and coordinates and communicates the product plans that will ultimately achieve Zebra's goals.</p><br><p>Specifically, responsibilities include but not limited to;</p><br><ul><br><li>Management of the complete P&L and Product Life Cycle pertaining to the product line.</li><br><li>Develop business strategy, product roadmap / portfolio, and vertical solution development / management strategies including management of the complete product lifecycle management in a variety of vertical markets including, retail, manufacturing, transportation & logistics</li><br><ul><br><li>Collaborate with cross functional, multi-disciplinary, geographically dispersed, matrixed teams including but not limited to; HW/SW engineering, NPI, finance, quality, technical support, training, supply chain, manufacturing (ODM/JDM model), PR/AR, service, corp./field marketing, TnV, tech publications, legal, demand planning, order fulfillment, IT, regulatory.</li><br><li>Drive new product creation/definition within Zebra Phase Gate process. We’ve used equal parts passion, expertise and innovation to turn stated customer needs (yes we <em>listen</em> to customers!) into group benefits programs that save companies and their employees money, while still providing the very best protection available. That’s getting people’s attention. </p><p>  </p><p>We are currently recruiting for the role of <strong>Systems Administrator</strong> to join our team in <strong>Surrey, BC</strong>. The Systems Administrator is responsible for general support and maintenance of workstations and servers, as well as the troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware, operating systems and applications. The Systems Administrator will work with a team of dedicated professionals to help solve day to day issues. They will also help develop a maintenance plan, document existing processes and help develop new ones. </p><p>  </p><p><strong>Outcomes</strong> </p><ul><li>Create and keep update a System / Service Catalogue  - First 90 days </li><li>Document and manage the Veeam and Backup exec backups – First 60 days </li><li>Setup and document a Server and workstation update system – First 90 days </li><li>Help with the upgrade of VMWare to Version 6 – First 90 days </li><li>Work with Sr. Network administrator on maintenance plan – First 90 days </li><li>Work with team on routine maintenance schedule – First 60 days<p> <p></p></p></li></ul><p>In addition to joining a team that is focused on delivering the “WOW!” factor daily (while enjoying weekly yoga stretches, lunchtime walks, 26 long weekends a year, and lots of cake!), your <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong><strong> </strong>will include: </p><ul><li>Manage the VMware virtual Network of approximately 200+ VM’s . </li><li>Manage a mix of Windows and Linux virtual Machines. </li><li>Escalation of support issues </li><li>Work with the IT infrastructure Team Lead to coordination the day-to-day IT operations </li><li>System uptime SLA of 98% </li><li>Managing, planning, implementing and maintaining Servers and workstations </li><li>Share responsibility for maintaining Telephone and environment (server room cooling, power, etc.) </li><li>Managing and planning Infrastructure related projects. </li><li>Managing and planning the backups and replication; restoring data and test recovery </li><li>Occasional evening and weekend work will be required when necessary </li><li>Plan and support software upgrades </li><li>Ordering cell phones and electronic devices and providing technical support </li><li>Registering domain administration, renewals, name servers and contact information </li><li>Providing telephone/technical support to administration, programming, infrastructure </li><li>Some travel between locations, Surrey, Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton and Barrie offices. </li><li>Preventive maintenance; cause stress in dealing with problem areas</li></ul><strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</strong><ul><li>Relocation assistant will not be provided</li><li>Shifts are 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. / 9:00 a.m. – 6:00 p.m. Monday to Friday</li><li>This position will be open for applications until January 31, 2016</li></ul><strong>DESCRIPTION DU POSTE<br><br></strong>Relevant du chef d'équipe, Soutien des associés, à titre d'analyste, Soutien aux ventes en gros et ventes au détail, vous serez responsable des dossiers des plaintes de deuxième niveau concernant le système normalisé de gestion et les applications des ventes au détail et des ventes en gros. À titre de membre important du Centre de soutien des associés (CSA), expérimenté et bilingue, vous offrirez un appui de deuxième niveau à notre réseau de ventes au détail et de ventes en gros et prendrez en charge tous les problèmes liés au système, aux activités et aux processus afin de les résoudre.<br><br><strong>PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS</strong><ul><li>Être le point central pour les problèmes des ventes au détail et des ventes en gros en assurant la liaison avec les groupes commerciaux, le groupe Gestion de l'information et des processus (GIP) et le fournisseur du service d'assistance tiers du niveau un afin de résoudre les problèmes en ayant le moins d'impact possible sur les activités quotidiennes du réseau des associés des ventes au détail et des ventes en gros et des invités</li><li>S'occuper d'un éventail de problèmes de soutien/de préoccupations liés à l'information, aux processus commerciaux, à la comptabilité et à la technique à l'établissement</li><li>Acheminer les problèmes commerciaux importants au niveau hiérarchique approprié, un facteur essentiel de l’excellence du service</li><li>Offrir par téléphone aux associés une expertise en matière d’exploitation, de technique et de processus commerciaux</li><li>Analyser les problèmes et mettre en œuvre les solutions de manière efficace dans les délais convenus</li><li>Passer en revue les normes et le rendement d'un service de qualité</li><li>Aider le niveau un en offrant une formation et une rétroaction ponctuelles afin de régler autant de problèmes que possible dès le premier contact, ce qui inclut la documentation des leçons apprises pour aider à développer et à raffiner les diagnostics et la base des connaissances</li><li>Contribuer aux communications avec les associés à propos du rendement du soutien</li><li>Soutenir les activités de mise à l'essai, en fournissant des commentaires précis et opportuns à la GIP et(ou) au fournisseur approprié afin de participer à la mise en œuvre de nouvelles initiatives</li></ul><strong>COMPÉTENCES EXIGÉES<br><br></strong>Suncor est engagée à l’égard de l’équité en matière d’emploi et encourage toutes les personnes qualifiées à postuler.<br><br><strong>Scolarité et expérience :</strong><ul><li>Formation postsecondaire dans une discipline commerciale ou informatique souhaitable.</li><li>Expérience en comptabilité ou tenue de livre nécessaire</li></ul><strong>Aptitudes et connaissances :</strong><ul><li>Bilinguisme (français et anglais) requis</li><li>Connaissance des programmes Excel, Word et PowerPoint et compétences informatiques</li><li>Solides compétences analytiques et en résolution de problèmes</li><li>Connaissance des systèmes des établissements de ventes au détail et de ventes en gros souhaitable</li><li>Connaissance des processus commerciaux des établissements</li><li>Favoriser une attitude de service professionnel en mettant l'accent sur le service à la clientèle</li><li>Solides compétences en communications avec capacité de conseiller et motiver d'autres personnes</li><li>Capacité de travailler dans un contexte technologique et commercial changeant rapidement et à un rythme effréné et d'établir les priorités appropriées</li><li>Faire preuve de confiance et de professionnalisme pour exécuter les tâches assignées</li></ul><strong>CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL</strong><ul><li>Périodes de pointe où la gestion des tâches multiples peut représenter un défi</li><li>Traiter avec les secteurs problématiques peut causer du stress</li></ul><strong>RENSEIGNEMENTS SUPPLÉMENTAIRES</strong><ul><li>Aucune aide au relogement ne sera offerte</li><li>Quarts de travail de 8 h à 17 h / 9 h à 18 h, du lundi au vendredi</li></ul><strong>WHY SUNCOR<br></strong>Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Embraces entrepreneurial spirit in work through recognizing and capitalizing on opportunities and challenging the status quo. </li> <li> <strong>Organizing</strong> - Can marshal resources (people, funding, material, and support) to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently; arranges information and files in a useful manner. </li> <li> <strong>Problem Solving</strong> – Solves difficult problems with effective solutions; asks good questions and probes all fruitful sources for answers; can see underlying or hidden problems and patterns; is excellent at honest analysis; looks beyond the obvious and doesn't stop at the first answers. </li> <li> <strong>Self</strong>-<strong>Development</strong> – Ability to recognize personal skills, abilities, limitations and strengths, taking appropriate action to pursue developmental activities and seeks assistance from others prior to job difficulty. </li> <li> <strong>Total Quality Management</strong> - Dedicated to providing the highest quality outcomes. Is open to suggestions and experimentation; creates a learning environment leading to the most efficient and effective work processes. </li> <li> <strong>Self-confidence</strong> – A belief in one's capability to accomplish a task and select an effective approach to a task or problem. This includes confidence in one's ability as expressed in increasingly challenging circumstances and confidence in one's decision or opinions. </li> </ul> <br> <br><br> Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics. <br><br> Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact. <br><br> This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development. <br><br> Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information. <br><br>Primary country and city: Canada (CA) || Ontario || Toronto || IT</div></div></div></div><div id="company-module" class="company-module container" itemprop="hiringOrganization" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Organization"><h2 class="container-header">About this company</h2><span class="hiring-org-name" itemprop="name">Ericsson</span><div id="follow-company-container" class=""><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/unfollowCompany/1060?csrfToken=ajax%3A6605012288355380172" data-trk="job_view_company_unfollow" class="follow-button stop-following"><span class="following-message">Following company</span><span class="unfollow-message">Unfollow company</span></a><a href="/jobs2/view/actions/followCompany/1060?csrfToken=ajax%3A6605012288355380172" data-trk="job_view_company_follow" class="follow-button start-following">Follow company</a></div><div class="content"><div class="rich-text" itemprop="description">A connected world is just the beginning.<br><br>Ericsson is the world’s leading provider of technology and services to telecom operators. Ericsson is advancing its vision of being the “prime driver in an all-communicating world” through innovation, technology, and sustainable business solutions.<br><br>We now stand on the brink of fundamental innovation opportunities across industries, public services and in private life. We are moving from the information society to the Networked Society, where the primary concern is not having access to information, but what benefit you get out of it.<br><br>It took 100 years to connect 1 billion places and 25 years to connect 5 billion people. The next step is connecting things. Ericsson envisions 50 billion connected devices as a starting point for new ways of innovating, collaborating, and socializing. The result will be simplified processes, higher productivity, real-time information allowing quicker, more informed decision-making or problem solving when relevant, and monitoring.<br>The Networked Society changes the logic of how society works. It is our job to take the lead in enabling this, and we are shaping our decisions around that. The ICT industry can help address our world’s major concerns in climate change, health care, education, and more.<br><br>• You find us in 180 countries<br>• We are more than 100,000 employees<br>• We have more than 30,000 patents<br>• 40% of mobile calls are made through our systems<br>• More than 2 billion people globally use our networks</div><div class="media"><object width="606" height="340" class="video-object"><param name="wmode" value="opaque"></param><param name="movie" value="https://www.youtube.com/v/VfrdAybK2cs?modestbranding=1&rel=0"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><embed wmode="opaque" src="https://www.youtube.com/v/VfrdAybK2cs?modestbranding=1&rel=0" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="606" height="340" allowFullScreen="true"></embed></object></div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div><div class="other-jobs"><h2>Other jobs at Ericsson</h2><ul class="internal-jobs"><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/99628277?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Installation Engineer (3 positions in all)</a><div class="location">Montreal, Quebec, CA</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/93869869?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Senior Java Developer</a><div class="location">Toronto, Ontario, CA</div></li><li class="internal-job"><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/jobs2/view/93873035?trk=job_view_company_other_jobs" class="title" rel="nofollow">Senior Web GUI Developer</a><div class="location">Toronto, Ontario, CA</div></li></ul><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/ericsson/careers?trk=job_view_company_see_more_jobs" class="see-more">View more jobs at Ericsson</a></div></div></div><div class="

Bezos believed that only the Internet could offer customers the convenience of browsing a selection of millions of book titles in a single sitting. During the first 30 days of business, Amazon fulfilled orders for customers in 50 states and 45 countries - all shipped from his Seattle-area garage.<br><br>Amazon's evolution from Web site to e-commerce partner to development platform is driven by the spirit of innovation that is part of the company's DNA. At Pet Valu, we're Pet Experts, and we're pet lovers, too. <br><br>Pet Valu offers a comprehensive rewards program to our employees including an employee discount program, an RRSP program for all employees, special offers on events and services, and a social committee to promote some fun at work. Full-time employees receive employer-paid group health benefits, a tuition reimbursement program, flexible work hours and time-off programs that help balance personal life with work. To support our employees’ commitment to their own charitable activities, we offer one paid day per year to volunteer at a registered charity of their choice.<br><br>Pet Valu is a specialty retailer of pet food, treats, toys and accessories with stores located throughout Canada and the U.S. Our stores operate under the names Pet Valu®, Paulmac’s Pet Food® and Bosley’s, and together comprise the largest retail operation in Canada dedicated to providing families with food and supplies for dogs, cats, companion birds, wild birds, fish, reptiles and small animals.<br><br>Pet Valu offers over 7,000 products, including holistic, national and premium brands of pet foods and treats as well as a wide selection of essential and innovative pet supplies for all budgets, purchased from over 200 suppliers in 11 countries. We pride ourselves on being pet experts and we want to use our knowledge and experience to help you find the right nutrition and other solutions for your pets. <br><br>Most of our stores are involved in their community, teaming up with animal rescues and adoption programs, and fundraising for animal shelters. In the past five years we have fundraised $7.12 million for North American animal rescue charities and helped 9,310 deserving pets to find their forever homes! We work with animal rescues and shelters to host adoption special events at most of our stores, in addition to the 80+ locations with on-site adoption programs.</div><div id="activity-feed" class="activity-feed"></div></div></div><div class="
